DcxcTtHW4sFX0b7FtgA9Sg.text: Very tasty! Bread are crispy and lobsters are fresh! But the place is quite small, hard to find a spot to dine in.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bTFRWs_bbNlJD54t92NPsw.text: I was walking the strip and was lucky to find Luke's Lobster. Its a small place located in the middle of the strip sidewalk, towards the mall area. This is a hidden gem if you're craving a lobster roll. Rolls aren't giant but to me it's the perfect size and the quality of lobster was great! I'm craving one as we speak!!! Oh and the staff is quality as well; super kind. Thanks!

geb1ajKmbk8t8bEkvXAG8g.text: This chain has not failed me yet. Consistent and delicious. Had the lobster roll. It's a small place outside of the Fashion Show Mall. Cute little outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

AAENUq4fJoQARQACkyLfZA.text: Incredible sandwich! I got lukes Lobster roll. It was a little expensive considering $17 for a sandwich however they do not skimp on the lobster! Definitely be back & would HIGHLY SUGGEST !

BqL1-xBSLVATdL1WWipeWQ.text: Now this is a True lobster roll! No wonder why Luke's is so popular.  The bun is slightly smaller but it's fully loaded with quality lobster claw meat.  $17 for just the roll only but I will gladly pay for it.  Why doesn't Cali has one?

hSqwD1gffAhJXFQjZxIkYw.text: First place we ate in Vegas, hit the spot, loved the clam chowder, lobster seemed fresher to me

s_PfZW9qvQDdCPf1mD8dbQ.text: We stopped here to grab an early dinner. This was a great choice. We ordered the crab roll, lobster roll, and the lobster chowder and they each had wonderful tastes.

cGoE2EwaQgUz_k_E8Syu_w.text: Small place, really good lobster and crab rolls. Freshly prepared, good quality, nice little yard for people to sit and eat.  You have my vote for a place to eat in Las Vegas. Keep up the good work, we will be back.

aHTs2PdsWoiC1pJLrK5sYw.text: Loved this place! Every other lobster roll I've had does not compare to the one at Luke's!  Dragged my sisters to try this place on a hot afternoon for late lunch and though the prices were unfriendly, the service was! My sister was curious about the establishment but the worker there kindly answered any question she had. We ended up ordering two whole lobster rolls, one whole crab roll and two lobster tails. I wish I ordered two lobster rolls for myself as it was not filling but the warm buttery bread and nicely seasoned lobster was so good. My sister loved that they provided warm butter with our rolls and lobster tails.   Wish they has stores in the Bay Area!

VN9StCVkawegtuq0SAwcHg.text: My family & I had Lobster Trios, our son(who is 9 years old) devoured it. Not much seating & a little pricey, but it was yummy & finding something that the Minions like or let alone eat is hard to find, definitely worth a try.

fmq4Z8BKT_NIILco0BwyTw.text: On my recent trip to Las Vegas, I decided that I wanted some fresh lobster roll. Between Lobster ME and Luke's Lobster, I chose to visit Luke's Lobster on account of better rating on Yelp.  Luke's Lobster is located on the outer grounds of the Fashion Show Mall, by the Las Vegas boulevard, close to the escalator leading up to Neiman Marcus. They operate out of a shack (or a pod, as another reviewer put it) so you may miss it if you're looking for a place that looks like a conventional restaurant.

tN4qVe_BEbDKhI9xDQtX-Q.text: Before I left to Vegas I did my research and sure enough this place made it onto my bookmark section on Yelp. First place we came to after landing in Vegas. It did take us awhile to find since the directory was a little confusing but it is such a small store that I was in fact shocked when I entered.  Staffs were super friendly & welcoming. Definitely did a great job of recommending whats good and explained everything throughly. Bummed that it didn't have any seat inside but lucky we got the table outside that's under the air thingie.  My boyfriend got the trio and I got the lobster roll with clam chowder. Chowder was really good, same taste with the ones in SF. The trio is def something for someone who wants a little taste of everything. You get half of each roll and our favorite was def the crab. I wasn't a big fan of the shrimp cause it tasted a lot like the frozen ones you get in the bag. However I absolutely love the crab & lobster roll. Super fresh and flavorful. LOVED IT! For 3 things & a water bottle we spent about $50, we didn't get full of it (don't know whether we were super hungry or just big eaters) but for the quality of the food, I can say it was worth the money.

wKHJNX-ah_t1VtcOFrBEWg.text: Fresh Lobsters and a delicate buttery bun. Melts in your mouth goodness!! Craving for more!!!

PcNkVHuBqE_rKpMWXILaKg.text: Awesome maine style lobster. Don't come expecting a feast for the price, but expect good chunky pieces of delicious lobster, chilled on top of a crispy buttery sandwich.  I definitely was full with the lobster roll and chips and drink combo but not stuffed.   I didn't get to try LOBSTERME but I heard that place is Connecticut style with extra mayo and salad inside. This maine style is mostly lobster and no nonsense, elegant and delicious. Worth

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll untouched. Delicious
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll with a bite

Dh_C_flbgcOUH7pCwUcbkw.text: Cute little space for a quick stop for sandwiches. I ordered the lobster roll for $17 and my friend ordered the crab roll for $14. I honestly didn't think it was worth the $17 I paid, and I expected it to be a little bigger. There wasn't much flavor to it.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab and lobster roll

vbwlkr7RLY0tMkEPSTw0ng.text: the bread!!! oh my gawd!!!! delish!!! i tried the sampler, crab, lobster, shrimp, i like em all!!! if i had to choose a favorite it would probably be the lobster!!!! so meaty!! just FYI they seafood is served cold, i could imagine if it was served warm with a lil splash of drawn butter!  but the bread has a buttery taste. i will be nack when the crave hits!

E2ceLV2cqSLrQDF9NQiLXw.text: This place is really tiny. They do have outdoor seating attached to the restaurant or they suggest you go up to the food court.  No thanks. The staff answered our million and one questions about their extremely simple menu. I ended up getting the crab roll and I was t disappointed. I could've used slightly more seasoning sprinkled on top but it was pretty much spot on. The slaw was average at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rEo_q7mCEE3uo1wlcl4A-Q.text: Probably the best Lobster roll I've had, but I haven't been to the East Coast for them yet. From what I've read and seen on food shows about Lobster rolls, this is an authentic roll. It is a split top roll, packed with lobster and light sauce (or possibly mayo). It is a bit pricey, but for what you get, it is absolutely worth it. If I was in the mood for a lobster or crab roll, I wouldn't hesitate to come here again. The shop is small, if you come during the summer, plan on eating inside the mall at the food court. They have seating outside, but if you are like me, that isn't an option during the heat of summer. They have pickles available to accompany your roll which is a nice touch. I believe they also offer homemade chips, but there aren't many options to go with the rolls. Worth a visit if you enjoy lobster and crab, the rolls are delicious and authentic.

RjO9h6UzEWg_VMxr8XSfQA.text: What makes this quick joint is frozen old seafood meat and buns. The seasoning is horrible. The texture of the protein says never, again.

C2uHNb04fi49qYJ81Nj2QQ.text: The best lobster roll I've ever had! Don't even bother getting the trio and tasting the other two rolls. Save your space for the lobster roll and add on a tail for $5

3rSCfR_r2yu_yOtUnLNwGw.text: Just wanted some good seafood for a reasonable price.  Luke's Lobster hit the spot!  I got the trio and the lobster bisque.  The 3 1/2 portion rolls were perfect portions for me, but my husband would need a little more.  The taste was delicious.  The crab was seasoned just right and the toasted bread was so soft after the toast crunch.  It was a cool night in Vegas and the bisque had the right warmth to knock off the chill.  Wanted a little more flavor with the soup, but the sandwiches were so good, I know I'll return again.  My 2 favorites were the lobster roll and the crab roll.

h8J9W4tqX5O7C1BvxQqpbg.text: This place, located outside the fashion mail, is FANTASTIC. Grabbed a lobster roll, crab roll and clam chowder on the way back to our room at Wynn late night. You have to try this when in Vegas!!

hv_G3bs3oREwyp3BcJDpyg.text: This is an example of an extremely well run and fantastically delightful culinary dream. The food here is so good. And the staff are courteous and friendly. The manager lindays was very professional and expressed her interest in us. And the quality of service we had received. I would highly recommend this as place to go while visiting or if you  live in Las Vegas

9nhRzLW1xhK3E-vG9pNJBw.text: Had a hard time finding it and I thought it was an actual big place. Ordered the Luke's Trio and it was really good, but small portions to share with any one. Crab claws were good and the lobster tails were small, but for the price, you get what you pay for. All in all, would definitely go back.

GY70UB3Lslaac441pwIYyw.text: Following Chad S's review, and being a lover of lobster rolls, this was a must visit.  The lobster roll was great, not cheap by any means, but well worth the cost, the crab roll, hmmm, not so good.  The real star though is the bread, a perfect companion to the lobster meat.  I am now a total fan of Maine Root Blueberry soda, so refreshing.  The only downside, the location, seriously, from a locals point of view, could they have picked a harder place to get to ?  Oh well, let's hope they open up another location somewhere off the strip.

NZbuYzLayM6vkmsyQMiGJQ.text: I'm so glad Luke's Lobster finally made it to Vegas.  I had it when I went to New York and was wishing they'd put one up here.  Staff was great and of course the lobster and crab rolls were out of this world.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

klsD1zS5InTBxUI0y80f1g.text: It was so good. We got a lobster roll and a lobster tail. The lobster roll was a 10 out of 10, the lobster tail was a seven out of 10. If you go get five lobster rolls and you will not be sorry. Unless you don't want to spend $70 on lunch or dinner. Then you will be sorry.

JVaLIh5G6_eUgK31r5qMlQ.text: Order A Lobster Roll I must say it was very delicious but for 23 dollars and it don't come with fries nor anything smh except a little cup of coleslaw it's just crazy and not only that the roll was extremely small!!!

stkCQZY1kJAyjtJ7LBf1pQ.text: Honestly I was excited to try it, but $26 for bite size rolls is a rip off!! I ordered the taste of Maine which is described to be  1/2 rolls of shrimp, crab and lobster but when it takes three bites to finish these half rolls it's hard to believe those are  1/2 rolls! And if it fits in the palm of my hand then what did I actually pay for? I'm extremely disappointed in the portion and quality of food I don't know why there are such esteemed reviews when you could go to Red Lobster and get bigger portions, cheddar biscuits and a meal for $30 and be stuffed!

yEgbaumva2cxkDAxTnUrXA.text: This restaurant has really improved with the reopening. It is amazing food that is prepared well and fast. But what makes it really stand out is the new management. I believe her name was Lindsay and her customer service was phenomenal!!!! I highly recommend this place to anyone who loves lobster and great service!!!

N8F40aHR7IfrTNYpYRQgbQ.text: Very impressed by their lobster sandwich. Pricey (but I think) worth the money. Lobster was stuffed between this bread with some awesome tasting butter. I also got the chowder soup which was rich and full of clam chunks. They have small portions but one can understand with the cost of the seafood. Great location (right in front of the mall) and a nice outside seating area. I will be back!

bf3ZVh-TCAiMjq2s1xM38g.text: Cashier had a shit attitude but I don't blame him he has to sell tourists lobster rolls out of a shack on the strip but the food itself didn't kill me and tasted decent. I think lobster me may be better

tKy2hMCGWqD42YTFq4cS8Q.text: The lobster was very good but I preferred the crab.  The crab was excellent. The guys at the counter are some cool dudes.

MYX-83KwI8q5IfFajzbWNg.text: We had our food delivered to our hotel room. My sandwich was cold, but still tasted amazing. The portion size was pretty small though and I was still hungry after my lobster roll and chips. However, lobster was cooked splendidly and the sauce was a great complement. The roll-to-lobster ratio was proportional, it didn't have too much bread as you find with many sandwiches. Overall I'd go here again if I was looking for something light, not if I was hangry though.

z2QQV7byjl2cesv7-jopEA.text: Really good! So worth it! Lobster is fresh and really good. Nice little atmosphere to. Highly recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best pop they have! Highly recommend it.
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Roll fantastic!!!!!

PAd4cTRH21Hztuv88TfSrA.text: Enjoyed this place as much as I loved the one in DC.  Got Lobsterme.  Just was really easy to miss if you aren't sure where the booth/stand is.  Try it if you (1) love lobsters and (2) can find it.

_kdMXvUbkBXTUPTMn2G_wg.text: This is a great place to grab a lobster grilled cheese. I like that they put on their chalkboard where the lobster is from. Highly recommend this place. Can't wait to come back and have it again!

tOnztW5B1lBDz3xadvvX3Q.text: The wife and I both had lobster rolls. Very tasty. Bread was toasted just right, and the lobster had great flavor. Wish the lobster roll was a little bigger, but I would say it was standard size. They do pack on the meat, so that is a plus.

TrMD_foQ7wp13t-US3mAvA.text: Killer lobster rolls! Yes, they are a little smaller but oh so good. Friendly staff and quick service. Best reason to go to the strip. I'll be back.

g0t0kyHxwsUHK1sHNsrN6w.text: Fresh seafood in such a good price! I will always come back to this place when I am in Las Vegas.

5C0c3pdQ-QcIg9gd9zmTzQ.text: The fiance and I stopped by for a quick bite before heading back home. Lobster roll was delicious! She also had the chowder as an add on (delicious as well). The butter sauce was just right and not heavy... was delicious. I would stop by again next time I'm in town.   It's a cute little "shack" right outside the mall with a few tables but you won't need to sit there long. I inhaled my lobster roll in seconds.

U1BkZ7caiyY4Ks0ErM8WUQ.text: In Las Vegas for vacation and heard about this place from a friend. Had great reviews so I braved the heat and walked over from Venetian. So good. Jumbo lobster roll were nice and meaty. I also had the crab grilled cheese. Very good. Great customer service. Cassie and team are excellent and very helpful. Seriously you need to eat here.

Zto1XCL1rx9XWn8U1CofuQ.text: Luke's was awesome!! The staff (Taylor, Jessica, and Bernardo) were super friendly, informative, and helpful. This was the best lobster roll I've ever had! Plus the coleslaw was the bomb. 10/10 recommend.

lKUTeCFJuuDqd4pVR_xGsw.text: I've always had a good experience at Luke's Lobster in NYC and Tokyo. Somehow today, the peeled lobster in my lobster roll was still frozen. Still ate it anyway, and 2 hours later, ended up with food poisoning. Boo :(

ooGe_M4A345wGA59il8-Bg.text: My cousins were in from New York last week and we found Luke's Lobster.....we HAD to try it and hands down we were all  SOOO happy we did!  One of my cousin's and I split the trio to see which we liked best...and then split a lobster roll on top of that.  It was just so delicious!!!  The crab is right up there with the lobster , and although the shrimp roll is also delicious, I think it takes a third place spot with the lobster and crab.  The pieces of lobster are large and you don't have all that mayo / dressing you get on other lobster rolls.  It was more plain but more delicious if that makes sense.  We also shared the lobster bisque which was TO DIE FOR!  I have never had bisque so good!!!  Thanks Luke's !  I can't wait to go back!  With or without family/friends visiting :)

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the best lobster and crab I&#39;ve had...shrimp is great too but I just love lobster and crab more!

g5j71neN_2BPGF4o0MrbbA.text: It was absolutely disappointing,half of the roll was about 2 inches. Lucky there wasn't a line. If there was that would been wasted time and money.

dZ3rv8pohDbEilfEATuyhQ.text: Super bomb lobster roll! And the staff's super friendly and funny too! Got a deal on a lobster roll, free extra lobster tail and free beer! Definitely hits the spot after walking all over Las Vegas...nice and quite chill spot too at fashion show mall, good place to take a break from all the hustle and bustle of the strip

kDAShtDoKOhF-WvsE3WF4A.text: Best Lobster roll in Vegas. Worth the trip from South Carolina just for the roll. Friendly and fast service

bPWrUsZbwKFbEPghnV_C6Q.text: I had the trio a lobster, a crab and a shrimp roll. I read the reviews so I decided this was the first place I would eat while doing my mall errands. Great rolls! The lobster bisque was very good but a tad bit on the salty side. It is a bar but they can tidy up the place a bit more, but overall the food was good, rolls were great! I would recommend!

T55PtvQ6C4RpIH2WIT4V1A.text: Came here based on the reviews.  1. Place is literally a little shack. Patio seating thats perfectly cooled off for this hot and humid season. 2. Staff are super friendly. 3. Side slaw is delicious. 4. Crab grilled cheese is by far the tastiest item on the menu. 5. The trio is a JOKE. BLAND COLD 2"SUB...I am serious. Its 2" with nothing but bread to go with. They hand you a shaker with a mix of spices in case you want to add flavor. Do not waste your money on this. 6. Drinks are cold :)  Not going back... I dont recommend it.

-WkPVW7QPWxnvJrf3r5nxA.text: The lobster roll was delicious - tender, flavorful, and with a generous amount of meat relative to bread. But overall the roll was pretty small - if you want an actual meal you need two rolls or one of the combos.

Nl8wS7wr1DgZ16jGmqQ43A.text: Lobster was fresh and nicely seasoned! Look very simple, just a white toast with chilled lobster but it tasted super good! Staffs were very friendlh too!

xSZuEcsCyhSR-7iZne4Gtw.text: The lobster roll serving has good amount of lobster meat compared to some places I have been. The only problem is there is not enough seats available and when it's so hot, you really need A/C and a seating place to enjoy your order. It's also hard to find this places, very tricky.

N0Wi7i__99O6ILV6VXbQRA.text: This was by far one of the best lobster rolls I've ever had. The toasted bun was packed full of lightly  dressed succulent lobster. Melt in your mouth delicious! Others have mentioned it's small but I felt it was a decent portion for the price. I can't wait to return.

EI3WBlXZVg0tRi4wHNRhNA.text: Excellent food and excellent service... robbie heather and maylonie . The lobster roll was so buttery and sweet my hubsand feel in love and so did i , we will be back

iJE5ZCY1lon1P8XLt4OUZQ.text: I'm the pickiest seafood eater of all time and this blew my mind away. 20/10! The food, the staff, the atmosphere! Tried the trio as a sampler of the three seafoods (lobster, crab, shrimp). Came with a lobster bisque soup and a Mexican coke! Simply to die for!

NAnIFTkPhv7RGtQORaQOww.text: Wonderful staff and very tasty Lobster and shrimp rolls.  Only flaw is these "jumbo" rolls are a bit on the small side.  But when it's this delicious I shouldn't complain much.

xeUJY3l0kG0flkJNFB4Y0g.text: Decided to try this spot  and I wasn't disappointed. It's a very small cute place. I had the lobster grill cheese and 1/2 lobster tail and it was tasty. Could have used more lobster for the price $13. Overall a good snack to hold you over till you eat again.

v3gHjdLvfHcfWPUr-eMX6Q.text: Well this place is definitely overrated, the lobster is served cold. The additional lobster tail is like a sample tail, and the lobster is so watered down you can barley taste the lobster. Not worth the money or drive, I live in Vegas, so will not be traveling the strip for this again.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1rC4xzyWRkYT-hFMJp_gcQ.text: Wow! Waited so long to try this place, so glad I finally stopped in! The lobster meat comes in huge chunks, it's fresh & their butter sauce is to die for. GO. TO. LUKES. !! (It's on the strip in front of Forum Shops)

i_QU7Wnsz2AVPZHQvm7ahw.text: Oh baby... everything about this place is just right.  The staff and the food quality are second to none.  We had the sampler platter of all 3 rolls and they blew us away.  Fresh juicy and buttery...  eat them with your eyes closed because you won't be able to focus an on anything else other than flavors and textures invading your mind.

R40Uy53tPsQwLMw0qnIdaQ.text: Wow....did I just paid this much for a lobster sandwich and shrimp roll! Got over it quickly and didn't complain to the staff on duty cause I work on the strip too. I just tell myself you live in a city that gets over 40 million people every year. Anyways, before I over think about price again. Let's get down to the food, overall everything we had was delicious especially the clam chowder soup. It was thick and had descent size clams that paired well with the potatoes and flavor of the soup. Makes me missed San Francisco Fishermen Wharf. The shrimp roll was good and so was the grilled lobster sandwich. Everything was fresh and lived up to the sustainable quality you would expect from higher grade seafood. It's something I wouldn't go out of my way to eat at but for all it's worth the staff on duty was very friendly and accommodating! Plus it's nice to have a bit of a variety of food options at Nevada's largest shopping mall.  2017 Yelp Review #9

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from LV Blvd. / View from patio / Shrimp Roll, Clam Chowder &amp; Grilled Lobster Sand.

spxMYCc9NzCkwgadtpjkng.text: Holy Moly!!!!!!!! Why is this place not all over the place!!!!!!!!!!I read the reviews but hot this place deserves more then what I can give for a rating!! I knew I was going to save this for lunch the day before leaving Vegas.  It was worth the anticipation and still days later I can't get it off my mind!!!   I ordered the Be My Valentine's Deal   $60  all the roll options 1/2: Shrimp, Lobster, Crab for 2 and 2 cups of Clam Chowder with a side of pure lobster tail solo.  2 Soda pops (went with the blueberry/lemonade)   Every bite was drenched in flavor!!!! I started with the crab it lit my eyes so bug with its bursting flavors! 2nd to go down was the lobster and it did not disappoint.  So clean fresh, and that butter sauce was a great addition! Lastly, the Shrimp oh! Boy!! The Shrimp! Not a bite got wasted! I was so stuffed from the sandwiches now on to the soup!! The Clam Chowder was served in a perfect portion size! The cup of soup was gone before I knew it!!!   The staff were nice! It's kept clean.  Small seating area meant to get in and out.  Rainy days prob won't work best here but if you are here and on this side of the strip its worth it for lunch/dinner or even a quick small snack!! This place is a Gem ready for you to come on over!

hOl79RxOj-IBxs-i5LGkXQ.text: 3.5 stars  A little too salty for me!  My friend and I shared the Taste of Maine ($24): 1/2 lobster roll, 1/2 crab roll, 1/2 shrimp roll, 2 crab claws, drink, chips and a pickle. Mind you, portion size is very small, but not out of the ordinary for seafood rolls. I think it's a good value because you don't have to fully commit to one type of roll and have later regrets if it doesn't taste the way you expected it to.  My favorite out of the three was the shrimp roll - not too overdressed and had a sweet, shrimp flavor to it. My least favorite was the crab roll which was a tad too pungent in smell/flavor.  We also added a side of clam chowder - good! But after a few bites, it became too, too salty.  Luke's Lobster is in Vegas is great. It satiated my desire to eat at its New York location, and inevitably, saved me a meal on my next trip to New York.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. taste of maine ($24): 1/2 lobster roll, 1/2 crab roll, 1/2 shrimp roll + two crab claws + chips and drink

cKsunX13a2bK8MlpKnLLtA.text: If I want a good lobster roll, this is where I go. Yeah, it is on the strip, but it is easily accessible from the smelly underground parking at Fashion Show Mall. Park in the red parking and go up the stairs to the outside restaurant area like you were going to Maggianos or RA Sushi. If you stay at street level and walk a little farther South, Luke's is a stand alone shack like place. You order at the counter and there is seating underneath the bistro string lights. Everything is completely outdoors, so be prepared for the weather!   What I love most is how fresh the seafood is, which is amazing considering we are hundreds of miles from an ocean. Also, seafood is the main focus, without being overwhelmed by sauce. The buttery, soft bread compliments the seafood well. I got the sampler, which are half sized portions of lobster roll, crab roll, and shrimp roll. My favorite was the lobster roll and I would get a full roll of this next time.   It's pretty pricey, but to be expected on the strip. Kind of nice to sit and watch the pretty lights of the Wynn and Palazzo and random passersby.  *****Yelp 2016 100 Challenge***** 13/100

Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/2 shrimp roll

Wpv89t3xajJqetcxoeaJGw.text: So expensive but oh so good! Well, what do you expect? It's a lobster roll!   Pros: for being on the strip I actually found their lobster roll was at a reasonable price of $17  Cons:  -only outdoor seating. Not great when it's Vegas summer.  - place is hard to find. I had to call them to find their exact location   Overall, the lobster roll was pricey with a smaller portion but the roll was packed with lobster meat and so much taste! I'd probably come back here next time I'm craving a lobster roll.

w1Ha5QPam38VcN_uIcW6zQ.text: Had the trio. Looked like a super small portion, but it was tasty and filling. Not a huge fan of the shrimp, but the crab roll was to die for. Really quick takeout service. Did not have to wait long at all which made me happy:)

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

akD8o_t2hN5wYFhhFOLX8g.text: At first I was a bit skeptical: $25 for a sandwich meal (lobster roll, drink and chips) from what is basically an outdoor food stall, but hey we're in Vegas so sometimes one needs to gamble and wow, did we win!  I took one bite of the lobster roll and I was sold: the combo of the luscious pieces of lobster, the perfectly toasted roll and the fantastic seasoning was nothing short of amazing. Honestly these puppies show up in my dreams: happy dreams when I am eating them, nightmares when I picture never having them again.  In addition, although seating is rather limited, just a few seats next to the stall: the staff did serve us at our table and was friendly enough to share the contents of their seasoning.  Highly recommended and will certainly come back!

wK0UIbvHbNPBvmSZpB3LJQ.text: The Lobster roll was delicious but quite small. So if your hungry you will need to a cup of lobster bisque or just go somewhere else. For Vegas prices $17 wasn't bad but again just not big enough. Service was ok. The lady working the counter seemed like she doesn't want to be there.  I did have a hard time finding it as it is just a small pop up outside of the mall. They do have seating but it's outside in the shade.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NkIys5cquLugCuuFqulXJA.text: Overlooked little place in vegas. The longer was delicious and fresh. Definitely one of my favorite places to grab a quick bite from now on.

iMtM2Q9-PHrUkYccRB4pJA.text: This place is fucking delicious!!! A bit pricey but you leave feeling it was well worth every dollar spent! Everything was perfectly done. Even the bread used was awesome.  I feel this is the way seafood should be appreciated.... lobster was totally the focus of the roll... The clam chowder was also outstanding and nothing in it overpowered the freshness and taste of the clams.. just the way it should be..

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MKDID4j3YH6P7JfoBVyaag.text: Stumbled upon this tiny gem as we're waiting for our uber back to the hotel...the location isn't very convenient so I'm not surprised that there aren't too many customers, which is good, because I don't have to wait long for some BOMB lobster rolls! This place serves lobster, crab, and shrimp roll. I only got the lobster one cause after trying so many rolls I realized that lobster is 100% my favorite. However, if I do get the chance to come back I'm definitely trying the other ones. I give this place 5 fat stars because Luke's Lobster does its bread so right--it's PERFECTLY toasted with just a little bit of crisp. With every bite you taste the butter soaked into the bread and the hot lobster...mmm..SO GEWD. It's an option to get your roll with soup--I highly recommend the New England clam chowder.

QYqXcB7V9aCAxWsNA8ZFtA.text: So good! We ordered the lobster grilled cheese and omg it was amazing! Cooked to perfection!  Also ordered the lobster roll. It was delicious, but very tiny.. like mint sized. So not worth $17 unless you have a baller wallet. Still 5/5- service was excellent. Very friendly staff and fun to chat with! I will be back next time.

B_F_Y08nc89KSNRlNzTJRQ.text: Tiny place but a delicious lobster roll, every bit as good as you'd get in New England, but on the Strip.  Give it a try, you won't be disappointed!

X6ElFhFb961_gGV8iqDg8A.text: There lobster bisque is so amazing. All the food is great but the lobster bisque is the Best  You have to try it!!! Leslie

bQABk3WiYIGuPQhrr7S_ow.text: Small shop in front of Fashion Show Mall. Serves lobster rolls, crab roll, shrimp roll, lobster Mac & cheese, lobster grilled cheese and beverages. Was $18 for a lobster roll but it was excellent. Loved it. Markets where the lobster came from and it's sustainable sources, etc. Says they serve gluten friendly but also says they prepare everything in the same space. Small dining space but largely just a walk up counter.

p83XaRkBfFY5O6OCpWPSZA.text: A random little spot that definitely shouldn't be overlooked. Excellent lobster roll, quick service. Tasted fresh. The cola was excellent, too.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent lobster roll

8nXQjqD67DrYpm2o_FJ-kg.text: Small && Cute Spot, right in front of The Fashion Show Mall.  Very Delicious Lobster Roll! Had to go back & get seconds :) Got me craving right now!

xhRmZ4by9qAuNlOUaxM74g.text: So good get the trio it's amazing I love everything simple fast and good I always get one to go

Yk7icNn6jcmA94NJHTAMTQ.text: Yummy!  Not fancy. Don't expect anything but good service and great food!  We went for lunch. Walked about a mile to get there and it was worth it. Only regret - we didn't go back again during our stay.

qjHEsFS3PJ_6xYqMTEmnAA.text: The 9th Island now has a Luke's! Go there. Eat there. Be there. As good as in The city.

L-2YcLEzJCW-0YCkPGKY4Q.text: Crab roll was amazing. Lobster roll was good both very buttery. It's a quick snack on the strip and they were very nice.

KzDtQdGTlTOsPn5xrpDaCQ.text: Just as good as the one we visited in Washington DC! So excited that there is one in Vegas and my kids are loving the shrimp rolls and the clam chowder! Hubby loves the lobster roll and customer service was spot on.

S5hfOI4NdbyV2v8SMnGVcA.text: Yup, very yummy!  Cold lobster on a warm bun on a super freezing day.  Good stuff!

QnMnU1WctI0J_3HgCShhlg.text: Great food. Haven't had good lobster rolls since I was in San Francisco. Will be back again and again.

lGCWUZ9_ab5wws-FuotP7Q.text: I found this "chain" in Bethesda, and it's AMAZING!  So good!  Best lobster rolls ever!  Real, huge hunks of fresh lobster, lightly dressed and perfectly seasoned!  Had the lobster bisque and it was really good too!

jc_qdmiLvwkwfgwLJ3dAAQ.text: there is just one word i have to say to this resteraut, wow! this place is amazing, great service, great food, great place overall. although it might be hard to find but its an amazing place.

RYkWRiZPQQGx_P1jgGE1ng.text: So, I didn't want to be one of those people who spend $18 on a lobster roll, but OMG it is so unbelievably delicious. The warm, buttered toasted texas toast and the cold, huge, giant chunks of real lobster is a perfect mix of everything.

eTZv2-SXXKIEv5dKwLzQ4Q.text: Awesome food, come here every time I need seafood. Everything from the menu delicious and fresh. Prices ok, the worst part it's the wait, they have line all the time so be ready to wait at least 30minutes before sitting. I can bring ur family and friend I will recommend this place to everyone!!!!

Gcx2WJ0W7ZKuAp-5yUf6Jg.text: The lobster rolls are excellent and the clam chowder was really good.  This is a really small place along the Vegas strip in front of the Fashion Show Mall with uncovered outdoor seating for about 16 people max.  Price was about $70 for two lobster rolls, two large clam chowders, and two bottled sodas.  The lobster rolls are somewhat small, but loaded with lobster meat and no fillers, just quality lobster on a really good toasted and buttered piece of bread.  I would highly recommend this place if you don't mind the price and limited seating.

9yth7X-fdCXyAHyXq5-O8g.text: If you are looking for a quick, great meal. Stop by Luke's Lobster.  I had the lobster roll with clam chowder soup...OMG...IT WAS FABULOUS.  A most stop. It is located outside of the fashion mall

CKkosXgrdES-c79fW3pZXQ.text: These are extremely small. Imagine the size of a hot dog bun and you have the size of your lobster roll. Food tastes great. Workers are friendly. Beware that you are paying for the real estate.

oaZQBX5FsRmx1ejQyPnbiA.text: We ate there twice during our 4 days in Vegas. my daughter likes the clam chowder soup.

f-Q3MhzYC4bPR6Br4mkjPw.text: Very friendly service. I'm from Boston and the lobster roll was ok. The best lobster roll in town is a food truck Cousins Maine Lobster.

tMhWGRWsHRHD25G3Zn6VbA.text: Really enjoyed it! Fresh and yummy! Try the lobster bisque! The lobster roll was fresh and sweet, the bread was perfectly toasted with a delicious butter sauce!

b1qlDMjJy8uyO--2MlHLUQ.text: I walked down the Strip to get to this place.  My walk was somewhat agonizing in that my boots were giving a what for.  I walked.  I continued walking.  Some girl decided to walk  in front of me, She wasn't bad looking.  I walked a bit more.  I had thought she was, by dint of luck, headed here as well.  At the last minute, she diverted.  She exited.  And I was here.  I ordered a shrimp roll, I ordered a lobster roll.  I was at peace.

ITbBW7IB89lT7XNGkjYdGg.text: What a nice little find. I owe thanks to my fellow Yelpers for directing me to this spot. It's an unassuming little building, but you can't miss the neon letters touting lobster! The young gentleman behind the counter was welcoming and had an upbeat spirit. He even told us the story of the company and how the lobster hops on the plane for Vegas right after being processed. The lobster definitely tasted fresh after biting into the scrumptious roll. They were out of clam chowder so I opted for the lobster bisque. It should join the pedestal the clam chowder sits on, very good. Prices were decent being its on the Vegas strip. I may just have to make the walk back over before heading home.

9pBle7s2FmNZdITO9B96jA.text: The place was so hard to find. We must have passed it 4 times before we finally found it. The good was really good. The price was good for Las Vegas. I definitely would eat hear again. The lobster role was super yummy.

okn03fDZVrW5NLHGZWN6_g.text: This is a little food shack outside of a mall.  The few table and chairs they had out were taken so we had to sit at a nearby curb.  Yea, my sister took me here and she paid for it.  I think greater than $20 for a few lobster tidbits is... ahem ... overpriced?  The meat was cold.  They probably kept it frozen to keep it from spoiling.  There really is no smell or flavor to the meat.  I'm sure it was fresh albeit frozen.  I had to dipped it in their cocktail sauce to bring out the taste.  I also tried their shrimp and crab roll.  Same deal.  Overall, if you have a fetish for these things I guess this place will do.  For me, I'd rather dine in restaurant and get warm, cooked lobster meat.

sjDAnrQNM3i-oGYNTMCmRw.text: Ordered the crab & lobster rolls. I loved both but if I return I would order the lobster roll again. The lobster meat was in huge chunks but the crab was flaked. I also had a shell in my crab roll. The service was good but they need to improve on the seating area for the customers. They had a few, dirty tables outside covered with umbrellas for shade. The problem was that the umbrella didn't cover the whole area so we were hit by the 100 degree sun. The blueberry and cola sodas were just ok. I wouldn't order them again.

2J7KUhpVnPmYzFrlQkmV1w.text: Little kiosk close to the fashion show mall. I tried the truffle lobster, It was very tasty but so small ... also there is only two seats inside the kiosk, there is a small outside you can sit at also. The menu is simple but tasty, nice for an expensive snacks.

Kzu08KUW6t1aa4Q_aSKTdg.text: So good! The rolls are served with cold seafood and warm butter sauce over the top. The soup of the day today was lobster bisque and it was the best I've ever had. My husband isn't a huge seafood fan and even he was impressed. Both the lobster roll and crab roll were delish. If I went again, I'd go for the lobster roll.

qpZRbHvOMGHg4SkjlPj1Cg.text: Food is solid. Service is good. Make sure to get your order in via the app! I believe after 9 orders, you get the 10th one free! Takes a lot of time/money to get to the 10th order..but hey it's better to log it in then not!  I was able to get a free drink with this.  My boyfriend and I got the standard lobster roll with some type of chowder. It came out to around $47...which my wallet wasn't so happy about, but that is pretty standard when you order lobster rolls in Vegas I SUPPOSE.  I'd recommend if you're craving lobster rolls and want a quick eat after winning some $$ from the tables. TREAT YOSELF.

fJuK8XNeHjJx5fLERjqPkQ.text: Luke's Lobster is one of the best places to go to and get a lobster roll or a shrimp roll let alone the crab roll . We couldn't make up our mind with just one roll so we decided to try the trio which has all three of those rolls I mentioned and let me tell you .... IT IS AMAZING ! It's a must I'm trying this place . Definitely will go back and order every time I pass and before I leave Las Vegas . You guys will not regret it ! It was amazing oh and their soups are also amazing ! Really good and full of flavor .

1K3sAxF7t2WQZY_d3xkmdg.text: This place is located right outside fashion show mall. It's a tiny location with a small space outside for seating. The workers were friendly and the cashier was nice enough to give me a run down of the menu since it was my first time there. I ended up getting the Luke's trio (three sampler rolls - lobster, crab, shrimp), clam chowder, and a drink. Overall, the food was good. The rolls tasted great and had flavor. The bread was nice and crispy. The clam chowder was also good. However, I feel like it's not worth the price. I felt it was way too expensive for what I paid for and was not full after finishing my meal.

mqFQW7tydf5iCz4oUDPESA.text: Okay this place was a waste of my time and money... Not sure why it has such a high rating on yelp because I totally regret spending my money there.    First, the place is small and cramped.  The outdoor patio is small, it has like 4 small cicular tables with a few chairs.  Secondly, one of the staff who was preparing the food was pretty rude.  The place is small and cramped and we were trying to look at the menu and decide what we want.  He was trying to hand the food over and around the counter to one of the customers and rudely asked my friend and her mom to pretty much get out of the way.  I understand maybe they were blocking the way but there is a nice way to ask....The lady at the register was nice though.  Okay now on to the food.  I ordered the lobster roll combo with the soup (clam chowder) and drink which came out to be about 29-30 dollars.  The lobster roll was maybe about 4 inches and not very much lobster.  The lobster meat comes out of a small bag that probably makes two lobster rolls.  I can tell you, I was so so disappointed and felt so bad bringing my friends there.  Spent so much money and wasn't even close to being full.  Also, the meat hardly had any flavor besides the powder seasoning they put on it.  Not tasty at all.  My friends order the truffle lobster roll and it tasted just like mine, what happened to the truffle oil???  The trio combo was just another let down.    To make it short and simple, I do not recommend this place to anyone unless you just want to try it and want to waste money on disappointing food!!!

b383S-rR_GfB3GF5LKpb1w.text: Was visiting Las Vegas recently & was recommended Luke's Lobster by some friends. Had the lobster grilled cheese & it was absolutely amazing! The staff was great too. Great energy all around! 2 of the staff members, Anson & Javier I believe were their names, were super friendly & made it that much more enjoyable. Definitely going back again next time I'm in Vegas

Nw5MRUwZV-QP1yYIm5S_3w.text: Great service all friendly girls ( Robbie, heather, meliani) were great made things quick and easy on my short lunch break.

eF-l-zwdsU7TrXfUf5RzeQ.text: Finally got to try it!! It was yummy as expected and even more! Going to become one of our fave spots in Vegas now! Service was awesome such friendly and fun staff!  The best!

Cu4ImXCvt-nPEWOvSoUX3w.text: Been wanting to try this spot and glad i did! in 1 word..."YUM" Great Lobster  Roll and Bisque can't wait to come back and try the Lobster Grilled Cheese (i call the Lobster Patty Melt haha!) Quick Great Food!

DXeey5pD6GfAnXLrv9j77A.text: Situated in a little shack on the corner of the Fashion Mall, Luke's Lobster serves lobster, crab, and shrimp sandwiches. If you have trouble deciding, ask for a pictured menu or just go for the trio (you get all three proteins). The rolls are all dressed in one way: a little lemon butter, mayo, and seasoning, very simple, but highlights the taste of whichever protein you decided to choose.   The sandwiches are reasonably sized and priced compared to other restaurants who serve similar products. Seating is very limited if you decide to eat in, otherwise grab it to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll ($17)
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab roll ($14)

dIXmmvCucgzF0RNuLQcMtg.text: I have been meaning to try Luke's for sometime now, and I'm glad I did! I am a native to Las Vegas, and love a gem when you find one. Don't let the size of the roll deceive you, because they stuff a whole lot of lobster meat in there, and being a regular at buying lobster at the grocery store.. this is the same amount (if not more) than you would buy for the same price just nowhere as fresh as Luke's. Plus you never find claw meat at the store, just tails. The bread was so soft and delicious, a perfect match for the delicious lobster. Their lemon butter was harmoniously balanced, and brought out the fresh flavor of the lobster. Parking is super simple, and Luke's is easily accessible. Park in BLUE parking under Nieman Marcus, preferably A's,B's, or C's... zoom up the escalator, and about 50 steps outside toward the doors at the side of the escalator facing Las Vegas Blvd. When you enter, you'll be greeted by the best group! Robbie, was so thorough at explaining the prices, and combos.. Javier hooked up my first roll, and YES! When I went back to get a "to go" order, Heather sold me on getting 3 more, plus the bomb.com coleslaw she had just made fresh that morning. If you're in the mood for some New England style grub, definitely check out Luke's Lobster. It's the real deal for seafood in the desert.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. And more LOBSTER
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster with added tail.. YUM
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster

7ZHu0mp2E19uJ8HpP5FDwA.text: Best lobster grilled cheese ever!!   I wanted to come back for a second sandwich it was so tasty. I, however would think twice about the lobster rolls because the meat is cold and I'm just used to my lobster rolls being warm including meat. Just a preference.   My sister thoroughly enjoyed the roll. The only complaint about the roll is that they're kind of on the small side for the price. You can eat a roll in like 3 bites and it's over.   I will definitely be back for the lobster grilled cheese.

M-X_SUvXgYR3evBvn1DHsg.text: My boyfriend searched up places to eat in Vegas before we drove out their for a mini vacation. He ended up finding Luke's Lobster on Yelp. Once we got to the hut after a long walk down the strip under the summer heat, the food was nothing short but amazing!   We got Luke's trio and a jumbo lobster roll, along with a side of coleslaw and iced tea. Bomb af!! They had a very nice toasted buttery roll and very generous shrimp, crab, and lobster portions. Our entire order for two people turned out to be about $50. In addition, the staff were friendly and seemed to really care about their customers.   Overall, great experience! The only downside is the seating area, which was located outside the hut with four tables, each next to a cement bench, under a tarp. Nonetheless, each had cute centerpieces.

wHH9v8wC9EFu_zUyo8r__g.text: Ok. I like to wait until I've been someplace twice before I review as it never fails to bite me in the butt to do it after the 1st visit. This place is hands-down, my favorite place to eat in LV. One, the employees are fun and up-beat, two, you can't go wrong with anything you order here. Unless of course, you don't eat seafood. If that's the case, this place is definitely not for you. Three, there is nothing pretentious or high-falutin' about the place. On my first visit, I got the sampler rolls. They consist of shrimp, crab, and lobster on mini rolls. After having that, this last visit I got just the lobster roll with the lobster bisque soup. Cold seafood salad, lightly seasoned on top of a yummy butter seared bread and delicious chunks of lobster in a buttery creamy broth. To. Die. For. It's a tiny place with limited seating and in no way fancy. The food though is better than almost any place I have been to in Las Vegas.  Did I mention it's shipped in fresh from the East coast or Canada?? They have a board that tells you where your seafood was shipped from locally. Get a roll and a beer and a cup of bisque. You'll be glad you did.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My fave! Lobster roll and bisque. Yummmmmm!
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sampler with cole slaw (much loved by both my hubby and my friend&#39;s hubby) and a beer.
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sampler! Crab, Lobster, and Shrimp.

f5vLM24_mlmNKikyijgZmA.text: My favorite spot in Vegas. The lobster is the best, then the crab one. Highly recommend the set with soup and drink.

D9rp3e63qtxwzadxeCjaBw.text: My husband and I both got the jumbo lobster ro combo with the poppyseed Cole slaw. The service was awesome everyone was so nice and the atmosphere was very cute they had outside seating with shade which was nice. The food was super yummy so much meat since we got the jumbo. Taste was super fresh I'm usually more of a warm lobster roll person but this is the first time I've enjoyed it cold. The slaw was really good and refreshing. Would definitely go back

_h5GS2AIYdQw2xp0RQ-NRQ.text: Luke's Lobster Las Vegas is a stand alone little eatery, located a the Fashion Show mall with it's own private outdoor seating (not dog friendly) and other additional outdoor seating surrounding it (if you do want to dine with your 4 legged friend like my husband and I).   I came by this place 2 Saturdays ago, a little before 12 pm. Only 1 employee was inside this tiny little place, behind the register. I looked over the paper menu and ended up ordering:    The Lobster Trap, $29 prior to tax- Oh boy, what an incredibly pricey meal. This is definitely a trap, the tourist kind. This entree comes with a lobster roll, 1/2 lobster tail and a cup of the lobster corn chowder. The size of the meal is good for 1 person. For the lobster roll, large buttery pieces of lobster is served on a piece of toasted white fluffy bread (not on a roll at all). I thought it was good but I would have preferred to have the butter omitted since a side of butter is served on the side so that I can choose to add it on my own (with as much of as little as I desire). The half lobster tail was okay. I thought the lobster corn chowder was average.  -------------------------- (Total= $31.39 after tax)  My husband was annoyed with me that I wanted to try this because of all the highly rated reviews. He scoffed at the price (but still ended up eating more than half of my meal).   The girl behind the counter had informed me that the outdoor seating is not dog friendly but the other tables outside around this eatery allows for me to be outside dining with my little girl dog. She said that she will have an employee come out and deliver my order to me.   Not too long of a wait, an employee came out to bring out my meal. He forgot to bring me napkins and a spoon. So he left and came back about 5 minutes later with 1 napkin and 1 plastic spoon.   Honestly, I thought the food was average. The price is pretty high for what I got. Granted, I know that seafood is pricey, but I have had better, especially at the price. And being in Sin City, there are buffets with good lobster tails where the admission price is ~$50.  I am sorry Las Vegas, but I was expecting better.   If you disagree with me, then so be it. At least you will have 1 less person to wait in line for to order your lobster roll.

kML_HH9G9_sKgzhPpuuW9w.text: This was the highlight of my trip through Vegas. They are petite buns as some have stated but toasted to perfection and overflowing. I had both crab and lobster and found I prefer the lobster roll. I added a coke and chips to round out the meal and was extremely satisfied. Go early to avoid the crowds.

The flavor wasn't bad but it is overpriced for the amount of lobster they give. I highly recommend ordering the lobster roll!
