op6KsNLocnB40jUVc0WkWA.text: This is the first I tried lobster (oh ya!! First time ever) and I'm in love with it. I'm greatful to my friend Clay who suggested me to try lobster and we were happy that we decided to give this place a try. Very nice ambiance. Very welcoming front desk ppl.

4g2c7RUtmseYU8QiU8LtLA.text: This little shop is located in The Fashion Show Mall, is on the first ( street ) level, you can park by the Macy's lot (free), or you can do valets parking which is also complementary, but of cause you reward your host with a little price. About 5 mins walk from the parking lot, just follow the Luck lobster sign. The restaurant is an individual little hut on the walkway, not inside the mall. You have to look for it. This is my first time here so they recommended the signature "Lobster Roll", but I want it to try it all, so I went for the Trio combos which is all of there Roll, which is Lobster, Crab, and Shrimp, also the clam chowder soup with a drink. Of cause the Lobster roll was the top notch, topped with hot butter and the toasted crunchy bread. I also like the shrimp roll but not the crab,because I am not a "crabby" guys. I love the decoration of the shop, it is small but is very cozy, that little patio outside is very comfortable to sit down and enjoy your meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Simple menu
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Combo
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One extra to go

SpQazdfsOuK83AAfvCJToQ.text: I had the Trio lobster shrimp and crab rolls and added a the half tail.  Food was great! The bread was delicious and the ratio of seafood to bread was perfect.  The size at first was disappointing compared to a picture I saw on the post!  BUT it was the perfect amount of food, not walking away being over stuffed!

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LvdXgEzQBPMSX-R__wJXoA.text: Bland, bland,  and bland.  Only reason I didn't give it 1 star is the woman working the counter were very friendly.  I got the half and half.  Both bland!  Also for the price you pay.  They give you a shitty portion!  Not worth it.  Will not recommend or go back.  Only thing saving this place are tourist on the strip that are hungry and don't know better.  I can guarantee of this was an off the strip food joint it would have been closed down a long time ago.

fgeeMQbv2IFZey8IQO60ng.text: I almost do not want to spread the word about this wonderful place. If you like fresh seafood, with unassuming atmosphere and inexpensive. This is the place. The trio is my favorite!!!!

4qZYdTfakmJs8dfrHxAzSw.text: Super expensive price for a food truck like place. 30% higher than similar lobster roll place inside Venetian. Taste all cold, no mayo traditional sauce, just plain meat. Crab is like from crab meat cans. Totally not recommended

pTOZFCxtLvI-OzB3-lhZQA.text: Only one complaint..the place is very small but I felt as if it shouldn't effect my 5 star review! This little shop is by far cute and amazing. All of the employees were sweet, welcoming and helpful with making a choice. I started off with the trio sampler combo that came with shrimp, crab, and lobster that came with a soup of your choice (I chose the lobster soup) and a drink. I'm not much of a soup person myself but that lobster soup was amazing! My favorite sandwich was the lobster by far but the shrimp and crab were also enjoyable! After having the trio I had to go back and get a full lobster sandwich! One thing that I enjoyed greatly were the portions! Most places would serve more bread than fish. But here at Luke's lobsters there was an equal amount of bread and fish! This will be my first stop the next time I am in Las Vegas! Thank you to the employees who assisted me and I am sorry that I do not remember your names..

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio sampler with lobster soup.

cw_HCCd2EZuV-C59ypYqWQ.text: This place is TINY - but the food is AWESOME!!!!  By far of the best lobster rolls in Vegas.   It is smaller than some of the others I've had, but the flavor is incredible.  Very friendly place with fast service and a location right next to the Davidoff bar, which doesn't hurt.

WuVGRw9bKIB_6zUUz3kVqA.text: OMG!!! Lobster roll is so good!!!! Huge chunks of meat, cooked to perfection, juicy and flavorful with great seasoning. The roll itself is "to die for"!!!! It was so good, I'll be back tomorrow!!!!! Selected craft brew (IPA), was also great!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

90FR6ysin5QB09LnsMxtOw.text: Delicious!! Tri the trio to experience shrimp, lobster and crab! The service was also quick and very friendly workers!

kdJfLlHUJn1-c0WaTxwdWw.text: Finally was able to see what all the hype was about. Ordered the lobster roll with a half lobster tail for $5 more. It was flavorful, but the roll was very very small. For $17 you would think it would at least be a good size. Don't save your appetite for this roll. It's just a snack.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SaQnQ_ZTbVYJaAkyuRVsCA.text: Having been born in Boston and spending summers on Cape Cod I can tell you that the lobster rolls here are the real deal. Served on a buttered grilled roll and loaded with cold lobster with a light mayo coating it tastes like your on the Cape.  The drinks from Maine were excellent. I had the root beer and some chips with my Lobster Roll. The clam chowder was also good. I can't wait to return soon. Price was very reasonable considering the quality of the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Sjof8bI0AsGCMEhVkn-wkA.text: I wish there could be 6 stars rorschach this location. Lindsey the GM does a great job operating this business. It is worth the effort to find it outside the fashion mall. You have to have the lobster roll. Toasted new England style hotdog roll packed with fresh lobster neat glazed with melted butter and seasoned with Luke's special mix. To die for! The clam chowder is about as authentic as it gets as well. You would swear you were eating in Maine, you just need George and Barbara Bush in the next table.

ecO_pG7NP_xfVwjSLaWcdA.text: I have had lobster rolls all over the Northeast and surprisingly the Lobster roll was pretty good at Luke's. It was served on bread that was more similar to a large hot dog bun than a roll that I am used to seeing but the lobster was tasty and seemed fresh. The roll seemed a bit overpriced for what it was and of course as I am always putting value into my ratings I gave 3 stars. It might have been 4 stars had I not spent 20 bucks on the lobster roll + more $$ for my sides. You will enjoy just beware of a bit of sticker shock..

yQPtjCFB7_P70FJPNhQeWg.text: So the Girlfriend talked me into trying Luke's. When you see the outside you start to doubt the quality of the food. Boy was I wrong! Absolutely the best seafood I've had in a while! Not too rich, full of flavor, I strongly recommend Luke's for that quick but very excellent different taste. I travel for a living so all the food tastes the same. This place is very different and well worth the price!

Xubw4rewmXCCU7VdnO7sLw.text: I truly enjoyed the lobster roll it was very delicious and the meat was tender. The portions are very small however for a $20 sandwich. Clam chowder was also very delicious.

J9n6Jh9ewoxdiVFjDVntKg.text: Why why why??  Came here famished with friends as soon as we got to Vegas on a Friday night. We were trying to grab something quick near the Encore and Wynn Hotels.  Three of my friends and I only got the chance to try the shrimp roll ($9), but it was so salty and cold. The bread was really good, but I have to say the texture and taste of the shrimp was something we were all not a fan of. The portion size is also not huge so this wouldn't be the place to go if you're trying to feast.  There were also lots of crickets in the seating area, which definitely reduced my appetite. Was not pleased with my experience :( But the food did come out really fast and the workers were quite friendly!

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp rolls ($9)

FF42rxYL92ITBCC1Ai15bw.text: Very disappointed after reading all the reviews. Place was tiny and very crowded. I ordered the trio but they were out of crab meat so I had the choice to choose between another crab roll for an additional charge or to get 2 shrimp rolls. I waited a while for my order and was finally handed the tiniest box containing the 3 rolls. For $20ish dollars this was a very small amount of food and the bread was overly soaked in butter. I will not return

8dCSkAkeIgCfzMsxMjxlOw.text: Seriously great simple lobster roll.  Lobster, roll and white truffle oil (or traditional).  Wow!  And at a very reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small outdoor patio

JQZu_hJntYc5UEntqaFXzA.text: Absolutely loved the lobster rolls and clam chowder here. The kind staff even made a special grilled cheese for my child. I will definitely come back again and hope the charming kiosk has a few more tables by then!

J3Z_Bh7Emby0JIijMW-1gg.text: Girls and I were craving seafood and came in thanks to the good yelp reviews. Walked in and were greeted by Murph (the manager). She was absolutely AMAZING. She helped us make the best choices and she was right! Food was great, service impeccable. This is definitely our new spot from now on when we are in town! Shout out to Murph!

shdPOU_cLQoYJl9f51OMtg.text: Delicious rolls with great flavor! Portions are on the small side but they tasted great. I had the roll combo that gives you half rolls of lobster, crab and shrimp each with chips and a drink for around $25. Not cheap but glad I tried them. Small building with minimal seating so not ideal when there's more than a handful of people there but the food again was great.

eqByuddXkKMqo5oS2ZgXUg.text: Really tasty, average prices for being on the strip. The staff are really friendly and not that cheesy customer service, actual people that make you feel like a person and not a transaction. The food is simple and exactly what it sounds like but it tastes better because it's quality !  Down side, it's tiny and when it's busy it's easy to feel cramped. So take it to go and enjoy the people watching is my recommendation.

X9ViEIITTcw6JJVlGegm1w.text: I love lobster rolls.  But when I first saw this place, very small located outside a mall in Las Vegas, I didn't even consider trying it.  Later when I was looking for a place to have dinner I saw how highly it was rated so I decided to try it for lunch the next day. I'm so glad I did!  One of the best lobster rolls I have had.  They even got the roll right!

9H9WV8QWKvf6RiCJXFd1xQ.text: The $17 lobster roll includes 1/4lb of lobster. Pretty tasty. Not very filling though.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very small outdoor seating area

t8Gd0tKI2fJRJ97d8H7wag.text: I had a great experience at Luke's Lobster in Osaka, when I saw they had one in Vegas, I had to come!  This option has more variety than the one in Japan. I've been to this location twice and have gotten the trio both times. I love that they have extra seasoning for you to add to your rolls. Although the rolls are great, I LOVE the seasoning.   Damn, I'm drooling. I could go for a lobster roll right now.

40RUT1nP4NeMfxRAGQJ4oQ.text: Must go place when in Vegas. Place is really small but the amount and quality of lobster is A+! Service is awesome and fast!!

Jj-2WGZKQ3mb4LbUHvCv3Q.text: Amazing! We ordered the trio which included lobster, crab and shrimp rolls. A perfect snack to have in their cute patio on the strip. Highly recommend to break your diet for.

AO8O3plA5qZbu0EZyl_RMg.text: If you're not on a budget in Vegas, pleasssseeee stop by here! The menu is a little expensive, but it's EVERYTHING LOBSTER.  You can't be cheap on that.  I like coming here for lunch since the portion isn't big so you don't feel too stuffed.  Especially if you have to get ready to go to the club.  I always order the Maine lobster roll which basically has lobster with butter on top.  I like to keep it simple.  The roll had a good amount of lobster meat.  You get what you pay for.  I added a side of Lobster Chowder and it was delicious!  There were actual chunks of lobster and the chowder wasn't too salty either.  There's a lot of different options to choose from and so far, I haven't been disappointed.

YBD-dYO5kmNRyuV-BCOQwQ.text: Awesome Lobster roll! Tons of claw meat on a buttery piece of toast. What's not to love? Worth the money.

O2IwIBZlztqpaNHJgX_CFg.text: The decision was made - the last meal prior to leaving Vegas will be provided by Luke's Lobster.   It wasn't difficult to find. Plenty of parking in the underground garage.   It's a very teenee place. They can only seat about 10 people, maybe 12 (but that would be pushing it, really.)   We got 2 orders of Noah's ark and a couple of clam chowders.   The sandwiches were smaller compared to what I've had in other places. But the flavor completely made up for it.   The lobster was my favorite. The other two were as good as I predicted. Seasoning was perfect.   Didn't get to try the clam chowder, but I heard good things.   Staff was so friendly! We got confused when we got our orders, thinking we were missing a bowl of coleslaw, so they gave us another one for free. (When we realized we weren't missing anything, we told them immediately. They gave us the bowl for free anyway!)   4.5 stars. Definitely making a stop here next time I come visit...

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tChxh6zz_H4teq1BSIxY9w.text: Upon arriving to this place, we realized it was a small establishment with a private outdoor seating place. You order inside and then go outside to eat since there isn't any room inside.   The cashier was very friendly and informed us of the deal of the day. I believed it was $10 for shrimp lobster roll that day, so me and my boyfriend got that, one lobster roll $17, and one large clam chowder to share.   The clam chowder was rich and creamy, very tasteful and is something I would order again. 4/5  The shrimp and lobster roll were decent. The size of it was small and does not come with any chips. The last time I had a lobster roll was in San Francisco and it was a thick bread that opened up to clamp the lobster inside of it. This one was more of a bun and lot smaller. The bun was actually good though, toasted with butter. The lobster I believe wasn't warm, more on the colder side and I would prefer it to be warm. The shrimp wasn't memorable either. Overall, I give it a 3/5.

sAE8rjuVdadzSAlzQZI_wA.text: Absolutely amazing! Friendly helpful staff, and some of the best clam chowder we ever tasted. Rolls were amazing, especially the lobster truffle. Can't wait to go back!!

VW-RF9shOM1CMQXzuyJGFQ.text: Yum, lobster roll sandwich was amazing and super filling.  The loaded fries were loaded with flavor and was a perfect sharing size.

RHplvkKebte_hqzukhX2kg.text: Love the food!  The staff is amazing and friendly!  We were there for a convention and actually went there 3 times in a 2 day period!  Will definitely be going back for another visit or 2 or 3

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Staff at Luke&#39;s

WA8Ud8uSNyJ-u3mccmJzxw.text: I cannot recommend this place enough.  Teeny tiny but great staff and even better food.  The crab roll tasted like they just took it out of the shell (maybe they did)!  The lobster roll was equally fresh and packed.  You cannot go wrong here.

HS1vKvJugqydFzVDNfL-rA.text: This hidden gem in front of Fashion Show Mall has the cutest feel to it. Right now they're having a promo of buying a roll with a free beer of choice. They had a lager that paired well with the lobster roll I ordered for a total of 21.65$ I know some might think that's a bit pricey but my motto is work hard and eat good! Only downside is the lobster roll is that it's a snack size.

uZ-GoemKytaP_psTNwSNlQ.text: This place has a great location on the strip in front of the mall. The place looks like a cute shake and there is a small outdoor seating area. The Vegas heat is sometimes unbearable so if you plan on eating here on a hot day plan to take your food to go as their is no ventilation outside andis the only seating option.  They serve their lobster rolls cold which I did not like. The grilled cheese was just ok and no competition against LobsterMe. The staff was friendly and did a great job going over menu options however I just was not satisfied with the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled Cheese Lobster and Lobster Roll

JOpSsm-7X7l-zXYX5SXLyw.text: Luke's Lobster is located in the Fashion Show Mall. It's a pretty small restaurant with limited seating outside. We got their Luke's Trio which came with a Lobster roll, Crab Roll and Shrimp Roll. The seafood was pretty cold, not sure if it was supposed to be like that. In my opinion, I think our meal would've tasted better if all the rolls were piping hot, maybe toasted?  Don't take it the wrong way, we still enjoyed it very much. Just would've tasted better hot that's all. Workers were very nice and funny, we laughed and joke around back and forth. Definitely would come back and give this place another try.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trio roll. Comes with lobster, shrimp and crab
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

fTj8Y3TDoZ2lsoxyC31DPw.text: I forgot to take a picture but I will probably not visit this place again. I'm a local and don't come to the strip often but I was here for a show so I decided to try it out. Wow the service was so horrible. The person taking our order didn't even bother looking at us while we spoke because he was too busy talking to the guest before us. He wasn't friendly at all. We ordered the Maine roll, mayo based lobster stuffed inside a buttered toasted little Texas toast. It was pretty good but it was really tiny. I wish I would have known before paying $24 for a tiny sandwich, lobster or not.

duvD9l33L2iVpeQIkI2hHw.text: The food here is great ...... Especially if Bernardo is your server!  Best customer service we've received in a very long time!

t-Jd17FOI_mC46x6cc2i1Q.text: Amazing Maine-style Lobster rolls! A little hidden gem right next to the fashion show mall.

6pgXBfP7d7Jnxr9pkDTHDw.text: Lobster roll was phenomenal. Definitely recommending this place. Heather was very customer friendly. Great little cute spot at Fashion show mall you won't be disappointed.

z9ZsXOrsKb4Ow-22xG_RpQ.text: Great spot for lunch. Lobster Roll was so fresh & delicious. My friend loved their cole slaw. Would have been nice if they had more side options. A pretty limited menu but worth going to if you are in the mood for a lobster roll.  I was staying at the Wynn & it was a pretty quick walk over the bridge, nice having options outside a hotel sometimes.   Extremely limited seating inside, 2 barstools and some outdoor seating.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y7jQifGO4YpaF9Gcg9j7aA.text: Just Like NYC  My wife and I have been going to Luke's Upper East Side location for years for a convenient lunch near the Met. Now there is a Luke's out front of Fashion Show Mall in Las Vegas.  Same simple menu. And while they have other things I always, always always get one thing -- the lobster roll. Unless I am hungry, and then I get TWO lobster rolls! Friendly service and for $16 it is a steal. Perfect lobster, butter toasted split top bun and butter. Simply perfect. The lobster roll I judge all others against.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gimme Two!

TsCgPyv7_5piEbfq18Lv4g.text: Las Vegas Luke's Lobster unfortunately didn't taste the same as the NYC location. Sad face. Also, one small lobster roll plus one small cup of chowder is definitely enough to enjoy and get full. Although small, they stuff the roll with so much meat that it's almost too much. So save your money and don't get too many rolls. Although small, they are mighty.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster corn chowder and regular size lobster roll

ZmY6HE0s_KTh7oN7KoRhrg.text: We stopped in to have the trio, we paid approx 35$. We found out after we got our food how small portions are. They were smaller than sliders and a really small cup of soup and a bottled drink. It's beyond small and thought it was a sample size when we got our food.. flavor was ok but not great.. this place was empty which should have been a clue.. but price to portion size would be my guess to the reason for being slow..  Response to your comment below:- What we got was not the size of a half roll, it was the size of a ritz cracker, I actually made a comment to the employees that you should post an actually picture or have a display of how small the rolls actually are. Your comment below was very sweet but when I was there and mentioned my concern, they didn't care., and spending 35$ for a meal that was a teaspoon of each was terrible.. I wouldn't go back.

Q-gbVYpEaP24iSxLlq59xQ.text: Amazing. We got the trio since we wanted to try a little of everything. Other places drown the meat with mayo but Luke's is simple and full of flavor. The best seafood roll I've had.  Forgot to mention that the trio are 3 half rolls which is pretty tiny so it was pretty much a snack for my husband and I. No complaints because each bite was packed with flavor.

eySrEthsFBLNlZxK_ZXtuw.text: This place was off the charts good, we got the trio sampler and the lobster grilled cheese. Man the lobster,crab and shrimp were so fresh tasting. My favorite was the shrimp, but the lobster grilled cheese was by far the top of the list. So much gooey cheese and lobster. Prices a little pricey for size you actually get but it was so worth it. Must try in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster grilled cheese and Lobster, crab and shrimp trio !!!
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QAqOPIoD48WtJm23c1wGaA.text: This place is amazing. Customer service in Vegas is  awesome. Wish they were open later...at least til 10pm... Its the Vegas strip. Expect to spend approx 22 bucks a person for a tasty sandwich. No its not big but its good.  Went to the S.F.  location too. Service fails in comparison to Las Vegas and soup is watery here in s.f. BUT the Sandwich was still good. During the happy hour you get a free beer...I noticed several people not get be offered the deal simply because they didnt read the small 5x7 sign. Lmao. When you have a promotion you should offer the add on.

zFohvAi5mDpRqOzgKQ4E_w.text: This place was outside of the fashion show mall and the location was small. It's limited seating in the restaurant so it seems like they cater to go orders more. We ordered the mini sandwiches and they were my favorite because it wasn't overfilling and they were cute ! :-) we also got the lobster bisque and some clam chowder. I enjoyed the clam chowder more than the bisque but they were both good. I really liked the pepper they have there at the table for you. The pepper was in a shaker and I put the pepper on everything I ate. We also added some sriracha on our sandwiches and it was really good with sriracha too. I really liked the lobster and how they prepared it. It was delicious and perfect bite. I would go here for a snack or like an appetizer because I felt like it was more fun food than a real meal, but it was all yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WKxQka1kkYmYWQlA2wb1cg.text: Holy smokes this place is divine. I didn't want this quick bite of lunch to end! My friend said she had been to other locations and was her favorite. I was just along for the ride and didn't know what to expect.   First off, the 2 girls working were darling so upbeat and answered any questions we had.   I ordered a grilled cheese with lobster, chips, coke and bottled water my total was $21 very decent for lunch in Vegas. My girlfriend got the lobster roll.   The lobster roll is served cold on a warm bun with warm butter drizzled over top. I tried a bite and It was delicious however I enjoyed my grilled cheese more.   The grilled cheese was super filling and had tons of lobster within it. I definitely feel like I got my money's worth on that of lobster.   Only downside of this place was the menu was super small and the eating area/patio was also very small only about 4-5 tables that could get crowded real quick I feel. Would definitely visit this place again in a heartbeat!!

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll served cold on a warm bun $17
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese with lobster
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese with lobster

pzoumV3Nbi41c54LsFn_YA.text: Came in the other night to give this place a try! Was greeted warmly by everyone! Ansun and I believe Taylor was her name gave a great explanation about the menu and I went with the lobster roll which was delicious!!

ZHMxPUL-967-Iel-QgJlOA.text: Seafood is fresh. Employees are always kind and welcoming. This is my favorite quick seafood spot in vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iKF8fHsXjgF0Og7P7Qfc7Q.text: We got a large lobster roll a large crab roll and clam chowder and the poppyseed coleslaw.  It was ALL amazing and worth the trip to the strip.  The staff was amazing and friendly as well.  It was about $50 for two of us but the amount of lobster and crab we got, it was worth it.  Favorites were the Lobster Roll and the poppyseed coleslaw!

OifjXjJjd0_Xi2jZUNYKTQ.text: Lobster roll was awesome,  local beer was great as well! Friendly faces, cool tucked away place to eat outside ...very small 5 tables but cozy!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll with extra tail Thursdays

XotwPIw9BsUsGoFCo_sPzw.text: This location is right outside of Fashion show mall, it is not a full restaurant, you can order and eat outside but if it is not crowded  they have like 1 or 2 barstools  inside but it is very tight in there.  I had the lobster roll which was pretty good, nice and fresh and the young man that took our order was very nice as it was very hot that day but they weren't crowded so we were able to just eat inside.  My friend had the grilled cheese with lobster or crab but she was not a fan but we were so hungry she still finished it and of course they are not cheap so we made the best of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll

33c2OILbSxXFOD6Nx4kUFQ.text: Food is great here. I got the trio so that I could try out all of the rolls and I was pretty impressed.

WIdQACNesjHBwnuPpVLF1g.text: Love this place!!! My friends told me about this place and I am so glad they did. It's a must try. Fresh, clean and great price.

v6RSUVsMDF54D6sF1LkKvw.text: Cute little place tucked away outside near Neiman Marcus. The lobster rolls were very good!

fpUDO9UTxZRu1HG-kNuSSw.text: Tasty lobster roll = the real deal from Maine. Would have earned 5 stars if the lobster meat was warm vs chilled.

YDhKvZsEpzfkuQVKQi3PeQ.text: OhhMmmGeee... this was delicious!! Best crab roll I think I've ever had, and the lobster and shrimp roll were also very good. Will absolutely go back. Wow, what a treat!!

Kfvg3tZ_-sIy-JFJNP6bkg.text: Fresh, tasty lobster roll. But for the price, I was hoping for something much larger.

_2aRM6hxi8_hTdOCIY-Rvw.text: Lobster roll was really good----------please be advised that this is real lobster and not imitation so the richness of the meat may be a little surprising to the uninitiated.   the cost is not cheap by any means but as a occasional light lunch it is really good....I will be back soon to see what else is on the menu

yiI59JnOToA8Ae1nWfErUQ.text: I wasn't too satisfied with Luke's Lobster after hearing the hype about it from friends who've experienced it in NYC. First of all, the lobster meat is cold. Second, the brioche toast is thin. Third, the lobster bisque was just OK. Maybe I was expecting too much from Luke's especially from trying out Lobster Me. Honestly, I don't think it's worth the hype or worth the $.

zUqwqQ96VqvTBtnmiK5qMw.text: My boyfriend and I really wanted to try this place since we had heard great things about it. I must say that my expectations were definitely exceeded taste wise. I really enjoyed the lobster roll but I liked the crab roll even more since I am a bit of a crab fanatic. Both rolls were stuffed with plenty of meat, which tasted fresh and was seasoned wonderfully. The clam chowder was everything I had hoped it would be and had tons of flavor. My only complaint was that I thought the size of the roll(about the size of a stuffed piece of sliced bread folded in half) did not match the price. I did a bit more research and noticed that the prices at this location was up to $4 more expensive than its locations in NYC. :(

ET7lanm2pjyaPDf-gex26Q.text: I'm from Maine and must say I was impressed.  Lobster roll was a tad smaller and a few more bucks but that is to be expected. The only thing missing was the salty smell of the ocean and the sound of the waves!

ulZwDU4wCrFPpCBQ-2_PqQ.text: I should also mention that this is not a full service restaurant. You order/pay at the front and then take a seat in their small seating area. Also of note is that they do not sell any alcoholic beverages. That said, the food is little on the pricey side but the lobster is fresh and delicious so it's definitely worth it in the end.

K-Gcb190Z3l7t6z5YIZBkA.text: Fantastic! You have to go here, everything is perfect and hands down for the lobster rolls. I went here to have my brunch and was really impressed with everything that came out. I ordered Lobster rolls and clam chowder for myself, both were super tasty. This place was just such an amazing experience. I would recommend lobster rolls to everyone to give a try.

om_I9v2ex-iSEjcgQuHemw.text: Best 2 bites ever !! Lobster roll was really yummy. Its a small roll but with soup it becomes a filling meal. I also had the lobster bisque soup and clam chowder.... Delicious. I definitely found my go to place for a great clam chowder. Its really flavorful with all the right flavors. Service was nice as well. Very helpful and accommodating!

UGMh6k0EokAMP4DmXLRE6Q.text: My husband and I are out here from Kansas. I had heard about this place on Yelp, boy I just want to say that's the best lobster roll we ever had. Staff was friendly and the atmosphere was welcoming. Keep up the good work guys and we will be back next time I'm in town.

I6A57kqSfBj8bzkBha8JAQ.text: Clam chowder is the bomb.com! No grits, the way I like it. Staff is friendly, stand is clean. I wish there was better seating tho.

WgEoMIs4paQL9O9Ipfg8Gw.text: We learned about little gem on thrillist.com. It was a chilly day in Vegas but no worries they have the heaters fired up. I was excited to try the clam chowder but they had just run out. We were encouraged to try the lobster bisque, so very glad we did. We started out with a lobster roll first and loved it SO much we decided to go for the crab roll too. We did not leave one crumb. It was toasty Texas style bread heaping with lobster and crab. We will have this again for sure.

u-l3VbY7Bdt9Dv0sJ-kr9Q.text: Soooo good!!!! They went above and beyond to help us when we ran up to the place 3 minutes before they closed! Tip: don't park in the green section of the fashion mall's parking structure!!!! Park in red! Everything was amazing and they were very friendly and accommodating. Best lobster and shrimp ever eaten period.

v8pWbLGQHSbFt980yC7q4w.text: Wow! This place is a gem! I got the Taste of Maine and it did not disappoint. The seasoning and buttered roll and swipe of mayo was delicious. I would definitely snack here again. The price is steep but the food is very tasty. But what do you expect from good seafood?

t7aSEnLLr2nG7arwCPsuLA.text: Accidentally found this place while walking around Fashion Show looking for a place to eat! The boyfriend and I were just wandering around and couldn't decide where to eat (none of the options in the food court appealed to us).  Then there it was, located in a cute little kiosk next to the Flip Flop Shop.  You walk up to the counter and after you order, you proceed to the outdoor, open-sitting area that's connected to the kiosk WITH a lovely view of the Strip.  The staff members were all very friendly and accommodating! Since it was our first time, they described the different types of rolls they offered and how each combo differentiated from one another.   We opted for the Noah's Ark, since it was the recommended option for two people to share. It comes with two sets of lobster rolls, crab rolls, shrimp rolls, and a couple of crab claws. It's perfect for when you're on a date or if it's your first time trying out the place. We were able to sample all their menu items through this order and they were all great! My favorite was the lobster roll (as expected with the name of the store, haha). The seafood was topped with a spice that added the perfect kick PLUS the rolls were melt-in-your-mouth good with all their toasted buttery goodness.   However, as great as the crab and shrimp rolls were, I would probably order the lobster roll for next time. Noah's Ark had great sample sizes but now that I know what I prefer, I would rather just eat a larger lobster roll.  They also have unique bottled drinks! So give those a try as well. Overall, it was pretty pricey for me but hey, paying for quality!

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Noah&#39;s Ark

_ZfikvfmjhNjT8_DLUEARA.text: Saw this on unloktlv on Instagram so one night came to try it. It's outside in a little area in the front of fashion show along Las Vegas Blvd. My husband and I tried the taste of Maine since it came with the 3 different 1/2 rolls. We also got clam chowder and lobster bisque to try. Everything from there service to the food was great. I can't eat too much lobster or I'll get itchy in my face so the 1/2 roll was perfect for me. I enjoyed the shrimp one personally and my husband enjoyed the lobster. I like the claim chowder and how the staff was super nice and explained how the process of them making the food went.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster bisque and clam chowder
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Taste of Maine

XBiTg_FZuU-kpNPRvB0zfg.text: Must try!!  The snow crab Roll only available durning the summer but oh so yummy.  The clam chowder has tons of meat and great flavor.    The honey blueberry lemonade is a refreshing summer kick back!!!    Great place a bit expensive but great!

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Snow crab roll, clam chowder, blueberry lemonade and salt and vinegar chips.

WTOeVRWu8cbc8rgI3ex1rQ.text: Great West coast lobsta roll.  Meaty and flavorful!  I will be back.  Super friendly staff and welcoming.  It's a small kiosk like restaurant with 4 tables (outside)....I hope they have misters...can't imagine being outside during summer...great food

nXVzb36EMkHtkzl-Fpumfw.text: Did I really pay $22 for a lobster roll and &18 for a crab roll? Oh, there was two drinks and two bags of chips with it too. Wow. So over priced. I know it's on the Strip and geared towards tourists, but come on man.  Any who....The rolls were excellent. The lobster and crab tasted sweet and fresh. I like the fact that it wasn't drowned in mayo and you could taste the meat. There is a small patio area where you eat at. It wasn't busy when I was there, but I can imagine it would be hard to find a seat if there is more than 15 people in there.  I recommend that you stop by and try a roll here. It's not something I would spend the money on every day, but now I can scratch it off my list.

91Ec9V7b6-gGSlDEdvplqA.text: Las Vegas, the land of world-class lobster rolls served out of a kiosk in front of a mall.  It really is just a kiosk--a counter and small adjacent seating area with five small tables. But don't let that keep you away.   My husband and I got to the register and had a little panic over what to order--taste of Maine? Noah's ark? The man taking our order walked us through the various options and was super friendly and helpful...didn't rush us at all.  We settled on the Noah's ark ($52), which features a lobster roll, crab roll, shrimp roll, two pickles, and four crab claws with cocktail sauce, all divided evenly into two baskets, plus your choice of two bags of chips (Cape Cod kettle cooked potato chips--regular or sea salt and vinegar) and two drinks (bottled water, Main Root soda, or Luke's Maine blueberry lemonade).   The combo gives you a nice amount of food for each person. If you're starving, I guess you might want more, but I couldn't finish everything. The rolls are simple--toasted white roll, a bit of mayo, piled with shellfish, topped with drawn butter and a sprinkle of seasoning. Great bread-to-shellfish ratio, and plenty of butter, but not too much of anything to overpower the seafood. So delicious! There's Sriracha and shakers of seasoning on the tables, but you totally don't need it.   Maine root sodas are great--made with organic, cane juice. I opted for blueberry, because, you know, Maine. No flavors or anything, just blueberry juice. The lemonade is made with wildflower honey.   Pickle was totally meh--not crisp, but that's my biggest complaint, which is saying something!   I love that they have a chalkboard telling you where that day's lobster, crab, and shrimp came from.   The service was consistently excellent, from the person who took our order to the one who came by to check on us while we were eating.   Prices certainly aren't cheap, but it's Las Vegas, and you're getting great quality, delicious seafood. Don't miss it!

wr9o2iTeJeUhHp7GfuO72w.text: ** Pretty decently tasting lobster sandwiches but for sure overpriced, chowder tasted a little sandy. Small shop with very limited seating.   Went here the morning after a pretty rough night, so maybe the food would have tasted ten times better if I wasn't hungover, but I thought that my lobster sandwich was good but not exceptional. Most of all I think that towards the end of my chowder, I definitely tasted something weird.. as if I were eating sand. The sandwiches are pretty pricey (~$20) and if I were to do it again I'd honestly probably wouldn't eat a sandwich on my broke budget. Don't get me wrong though, it was still tasty, just a bit overpriced and nothing out of this world.   There's only a small area of seating with a few tables, but whoever designed the building didn't do the best job. My friends and I kept laughing about the total inefficiency of watching the server walk out of the kitchen to the strip, all the way back inside the front entrance and through the restaurant just to serve food at the patio and go back for each order. That's a total of six doors to go through and a lot of walking for every order, when they should have connected the kitchen to the patio through a door or made it more accessible for service.

Everything tasted amazing, and despite any qualms my husband and I had about eating seafood out in the heat, the lobster meat refreshed us completely!  We ordered the trio, the half lobster tail, lobster corn chowder, and an original lobster roll. All of this with one drink came out to be around $50. oxl7GJnHEK2OWNAYYGXR_A.text: I absolutely love the lobster rolls, but I decided to try the lobster grilled cheese. Basically a grilled cheese with Gruyere cheese and lobster. A reasonable amount of lobster, but I prefer a mix of cheese with a more buttery effect like the Devilicious Butter Poached Lobster Grilled Cheese in San Diego.   I recommend my normal go to order of two lobster rolls than any of their other menu items... Or to save money the chips/beverage combo.

js4eZ6JjNY_rCEeYS7RdGw.text: I've been eyeing this place for awhile now, and now I finally tried it! The bread and lobster just melts in your mouth! Although the portion size is small, it's worth the appetizer. It won't get you full thought but it's definitely worth the try. When we arrived here, their stand wasn't as busy but I'm sure they get busy throughout the day. Next time when I come again, I would try their trio, which is lobster, crab and shrimp. I can't wait to stop by!!!

Shnnsw-PHnYwOE_K7D14fA.text: The bread was great, the lobster was fresh and it's on Las Vegas Blvd where even water is over priced. If you are looking for a bargain go somewhere else, if you are looking for a good sandwich that you can't find in most places give it a try. By golly, don't be surprised when you are paying a fair amount because ummm it is good quality seafood. I didn't know what to expect but I wish I would have tried more of their options, I could have easily managed to push down some soup at least. This is nowhere near anything I do on a regular basis but if I were in the area and felt like spending $50-$60 for lunch I'd go again.

W9z-1QEqG0JvZ8QDW4W84A.text: I had my husband stand in line to get 2 orders (one for him and one for me) of the Trio.  He waited in line for at least 30-60 minutes and by the time it was his turn, they were out of crab so they substituted it with shrimp.  Doesn't crab cost more than shrimp?  To me, it would of been fair if we received half lobster and half shrimp to make up the difference of the price.  How long does it take to boil seafood, mix it with seasoning and scoop it on bread?  Also, instead of receiving 2 orders, we received one order but I guess the good part was, we were only charged for one.   Also, the size of each roll is small to tiny.  A few bites and you're done!  In terms of taste, it was good but not worth the wait.  When it comes to seating, it's non-existence.  If you want to eat here, be prepare for the long wait and standing while you're eating.

xhprqMOXvMDFBozWHspHQA.text: "Did I just really just pay $18.40 for THIS?" I asked my friend as I opened up the cutesy tiny take-out box my lobster roll came in. It was the length of those regular sized hot dog buns you buy at the grocery store..but to be fair, it was filled generously with 1/4 lb of wild-caught lobster.   Now I'm no lobster roll connoisseur (this is my second time trying one - first was at Disneyland's Harbour Galley and it looked better than it tasted), but I like to think I can tell what's damn good food when I eat some. And this, this is a damn good lobster roll! You can ask them to exclude the butter, mayo, or spices from your roll and as much as I don't like overly-greasy things, I decided to try it as they would normally prepare it. And unless you're vegan or something, I would suggest you do the same. They're light handed with the lemon butter/mayo anyways - I literally saw them use a huge dropper to put it on.  Gotta hand it to New England for making the perfect buns..the inside is so pillowy and soft, with a lightly buttered toasted outside..it reminds me of Texas toast. Plus the split-top makes it way less likely to drop any pieces of the precious cargo loaded inside. The large chunks of lobster were chilled and while some people have mentioned they would prefer the lobster warm, I think it's more fresh tasting chilled. Put some sriracha on and sprinkled some more of their seasoning and it was pure perfection.  So was it worth it? Absolutely. Although it was small, it was ended up being quite satiating and in hind sight, I would much rather prefer that lobster to roll ratio with that quality than vice versa. Hell, even though I have a new-found allergy to lobster (noticed a rash all over my forehead when I got home), I'd come back for another one the next time I'm feeling spendy!

YsJv046sWu7t39zC1GDyGA.text: Unassuming place at Fashion Mall on the Strip. Very friendly, great service and good advice about the food. Really like the combo of cool lobster and toasty bun. Plus not at all 'fatty tasting' like some lobster can be. And don't miss the coleslaw. Even with the heat, the outdoor seating area is well protected and misted. Will go back to this one or other Luke's.

IzQtEOO9nheN2_G8XXD7YA.text: We got the lobster roll and the clam chowder. Let's just start by saying we spent $70 and the portion sizes are incredibly small, mind you we got the jumbo sizes in the rolls. The meat comes cold and completely flavorless. Not worth the price AT ALL. I could've probably justified the price if the taste was there, but it wasn't. Incredibly disappointed especially with all the great reviews I has seen.

The Luke's in NY I still have dreams about eating that's how good it was. I've only been to this location once so maybe it was an off day but my lobster roll didn't have enough flavor and they forgot to give us lemon. 0D8ddK9ITld9clZqAsu79w.text: 4 stars for service 1 star for taste of food. The people were nice, but didn't take the time to explain that they serve only cold lobster. I wish they had mentioned that when we were ordering since it was low 40s outside and one of their heat lamps wasn't working. When we got the lobster it didn't have much flavor and the butter dipping sauce was just melted butter with nothing special to it. I was expecting more flavor. What cancelled out any hope of flavor was it being cold and sitting in a damp shell. I'm sure it has a different taste during what seasons, but to us it was bland. If you want excellent flavor lobster try Lobster Me. All lobster is hot in any for they have and they add different flavoring to it to make it fantastic.

H1tElgaQDahhC2EdiKURuA.text: It's my first time having lobster roll, and I totally fell in love with it! In the first bite, you taste this fresh chunky piece of lobster (and some seawater, yea, that's how fresh it is). Along with it there is some mayo and butter with the toasted bread, which totally takes the lobster roll to a whole new level . The combination is just beyond awesome! You really have to try it yourself.  The only down side is the portion is kind of small. It is slightly longer and thinner the size of my palm. Usually I would be full by eating a salad but I was only half full after I finished.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll ($17)

A5Z6VgmyM9t1M0WU_nRKDQ.text: While in Vegas, we stayed at the Wynn. Food is okay there, but we say this right across the street and decided to try it. I got the lobster grilled cheese with some clam chowder. So delicious! The only downside was we were in Vegas in November and it was cold, and there's no indoor seating so we were inevitably freezing. Aside from that great good!

pHq4u-3A2I68WU3U-_Mc0Q.text: I loved this place. Very flavorful & affordably priced. We tried the sampler & it was deliciously satisfying. I was able to taste the shrimp, lobster & crab roll. Every roll was great. Small dining area, so no big groups.

69hzxgyTWu_vhqS5JcKa5A.text: Okay so I have been starring at their rolls for a while and finally pulled the trigger. I went down Friday evening and surprisingly the only person there. The employees greeted me and I ordered, what happened next was pure bliss. I had the taste of Maine,1/2 shrimp, crab and lobster. It was completely amazing. My mouth was soooo happy with the favors. The lemon butter on top was amazing. I got 2 lobster rolls to go and they were fine when I got home to Hendo. I would highly recommend this place and will be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A taste of Maine

VYdBE2GckQvFoUQJIba3sg.text: Their lobster rolls are fairly delicious, but as other reviewers have mentioned, it is fairly small in size for the price. It is pretty reasonable to add a lobster tail however for a small additional price! Would recommend to individuals as a small snack, but a lobster roll by itself is probably not sufficient for an adequate meal.

3Ay6vARZZhx48DlvTgxDWQ.text: Lobster rolls are alright but nothing to write home about. Given what you're getting, though, it's pretty expensive.

WTT-dhiLqec80WM3VN0_2A.text: Boyfriend and I loved this place!  As a self-proclaimed seafood lover (& witnessed by many) I had bookmarked this place months ago.  We were finally resolved to try it last weekend during our recent Vegas trip.  It's located in the fashion square mall area next to Treasure Island.  It's located on the first floor, near the corner of the street, by Nieman Marcus and the Sugar Factory.  It's a tiny little shack, but based on the reviews, even a line down the street wouldn't have deterred us.    Thank goodness, all was quiet, and we immediately ordered 1 Taste of Maine for $26: 1 mini lobster roll, 1 mini crab roll, and 1 mini bay shrimp roll,  2 small Jonah crab claws, 1 pickle, 1 bag o chips or side o slaw, and 1 drink.  The idea was we'd order this to share, and then order more of whatever roll we ended up liking.  So anyway, slight complaint: they only have regular chips and salt and vinegar chips.  I guess that's all you need but....we're in Vegas.  I want more choices, damn it.  The drinks were bottled and unique and cold.  Boyfriend chose a Ginger Brew drink that was natural and had a really nice ginger zing.  I ate a crab claw and took one bite of the shrimp roll and said, forget it, I'm getting my own, and immediately went back to the counter to order my own sampler, this time with slaw and a honey blueberry lemonade (SO GOOD, but more for sipping, less for washing down shellfish).   We both gulped down our food in their cute little patio dining area that was nicely covered by umbrellas.  I thought we'd still be hungry but we were pleasantly full.  Besides, we had a steak dinner to go to in a mere 6 hours.  The stand out for me was actually the bay shrimp roll.  But all the seafood was beautifully fresh, wonderfully seasoned and the bread was perfectly toasted and buttered.  Yummy balance of salty, sweet, briny, buttery....mmmm.... The pickle was great.  The drinks I mentioned.  The slaw was.....strange....a kind of mayo-less, vinegar, honey-mustard concoction.  I'd skip it next time.  Maybe some people like it.  Anyway, can't wait to return.  Good stuff, yo.

aINxZkcDo8ZnwFVAUP4Oeg.text: This place was a great find. Worth the price. Crab and lobster on a butter toasted bun. Have been twice this week. Delicious :-)

i9G3NjcUaM8QvhYyQVoxow.text: Great food, staff and service! I will be a regular here for sure! I had the lobster roll, clam chowder,Salt n Vinegar Chips and Mexicana Soda. Yummmm

Ak1NRVUYZySqdbqaYvqC-Q.text: All I have to say is Mmmm.  To the chowder, to the lobster roll, and damn, even the pickles.  Definitely a place worth going to if in Vegas.  Lobster rolls are good in general to try.

6wC2x2gIXUjtbj6gqcQo9Q.text: Chilled lobster on a warm toasted buttery fresh bun dusted lightly with their herbed seasoning and a touch of mayo. Friendly quick service. I so wanted to try their clam chowder but it so hot out here!! But this is a great cool sandwich on a hot day.

kX6e3gSvMXrFBBw23n4kbQ.text: Luke's Lobster is a tiny little shack right on the strip and it is a gem. I tried the lobster roll and the lobster grilled cheese and both were amazing. The simplicity of the roll really allowed you to experience the flavor of the lobster, which tasted very fresh. The grilled cheese was also very tasty. If you happen to go to the fashion mall you should make a quick stop and try the food this shack has to offer.

8Pv3MwNgm0M3pwJab9nX9Q.text: lobster roll!  just try it!  no more, no less, just do it!!

-oUhYF08iF12Xs_yW9S-ug.text: I've had great lobster rolls in the Boston and Charleston, SC areas. Therefore, I have a high bar and frame of reference. Luke's was so good I went to this spot 2x during my Vegas trip!! Had the Luke's Trio on the 1st visit. My 2nd visit, I enjoyed the Lobster Roll. The meat is fresh, succulent and there's something special about that seasoning they add!  BTW, also being a self-appointed "ginger connoisseur" :-D, the Maine Root ginger beer is also fantastic.

zpKhnI2S0oLNSwqItKkHbg.text: This is probably my favorite spot for lobster rolls in Vegas right now. Their lobster bisque wasn't what I was expecting but still good. Wish I was able to make it down more often.

hrjdx6rYxok50QG2IMH76w.text: Legit delish. Been here a couple times, good food, awesome customer service. When I miss back east lobsta roll it's a solid choice.

OqLUVkTvSufBKLI7Ia6a2Q.text: This place is better than Lobster me at PH and The Venetian in my opinion. Their rolls may be small, but they sure pack a lot of flavor. The location is bad because it is hard to find. It is a small hut and seating is outdoors. But the food makes up for that. The prices are high for the amount of food you get. But after going to other lobster places, I will probably go for the Noah's Ark next time just to try it out. Oh, and they get your order right unlike other places previously mentioned!

kp75Ja-7TAVnZ40VcYNXWw.text: The lobster roll was delicious. Beer on tap was good. The place is very small but the patio is super cute with lights and misters to keep cool.

NYOJ9yitV_yId6dA6KQRvg.text: Very casual and easy-to-get street food in Vegas. Had ordered the trio, very delicious, highly recommended. We did not eat them directly, but rather wait until we got back to the hotel room. By that time, they were cold (the bun), but still surprisingly tasty. Will definitely come back when visiting Vegas the next time and try them when freshly made. Highly recommended, and you cannot go wrong with trio!

tEbQjm9_9dbsKDDtwKxkBg.text: This is probably a three and a half star place. Everything was overly salted. My husband doesn't agree though so it's all relative. I got the trio. Rating it from lowest to highest would be shrimp, lobster then crab. They put the same seasoning on all three so the seafood really speaks for itself. The lobster bisque flavor was good but the soup base was clumpy from the flour. They could improve the execution of this particular recipe.

yyWSkQEjaoZ4sxtkFwYEZg.text: This was a great stop small shop with nice seating outside kinda private. The food was delightful pricey but worth it. They actually pack on the lobster. The lobster rolls are great i just wish the lobster was warm they toast the bun and put on warm butter delicious however if the lobster was warm it would be of the top. The mac and cheese was also great a must if your near by. I will definitely be coming back here soon highly recommended.

3c2bnOjGv9ChwAk_oh3M5Q.text: This was the second best lobster roll I've ever had (the other was on the coast of Maine).  It was plentiful and worth the price.  My husband got the coleslaw and it was fresh and flavorful.  We are stopping by to grab another on our way out of town (which is inconvenient), that is how much we liked them.

yuhsQXg3gmFW_ysJL4L6hQ.text: Best lobster rolls in Vegas. Been coming here since it opened. All fresh lobster and crab imported twice a week from Maine and other popular fishing areas. Always super fresh. Al title pricey but not bad for the strip. Service is usually great and the sitting area is pretty unique. Would recommend a visit when stopping in Vegas. Try the lobster or crab grilled cheese that is seasonal for winter!

JAo0IBru7yuGFyGWRFJYNA.text: Was expecting a bigger location. But it was small with 4 outdoor tables. No alcohol but they allowed me to go next door and buy my booze and bring it back in. dJGaod_XT3BpJwX2_jgPtg.text: Luke's lobster is a great on the go food spot. I stopped in and tried their trio to go. The food was quite flavorful, I just wish it was hot or even warm but unfortunately the food was cold which took away from the overall rating. For first timers, I would like to point out that the establishment is very small- only 2 inside bar stools and a small outside patio. With it being cold, I opted not to sit outside. Despite the temperature of the food, I would probably come back and request the sandwich to be hot.

O9WYrjNoATxxbvz15QBOxg.text: I found this place on Yelp and as soon as I got to Vegas it was mandatory. The food was absolutely amazing the staff was great and I posted the pics on Facebook so now everyone wants them to come to Houston, Texas.!! Will make this my stop every time I'm in Vegas !

UbnhRT0o4U528Zjy9ONGKg.text: Cozy place. I had lobster, crab sandwiches and the crab soup. It was tasty! Wish it could be heated warmer though. Overall I like their food and would like to go again.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8XkOefs3H3s2ocDYVdvr9g.text: Luke's Lobster is this little shack outside of the Fashion Show Mall. Every time I'm around, I try to make a stop to this place. Their crab roll and their clam chowder are super delicious and I love how they serve some really great soda glass bottles. The issue about this place is that it is super overpriced. For two people, you're looking at spending $60 on food only to have to take a stop by a fast food place or something because their portions won't satisfy your hunger. It is a great snack, so my advice, don't come here hungry. However, I still highly recommend trying this place because their food is really good!

h-vojsHWMlASlrjeJoTIqg.text: Had 1/2 a lobster roll and the lobster grilled cheese.  Both were amazing. Made me want more of the lobster roll. Seating was limited, but we were lucky enough to grab a spot. No lines made it even better. Will definitely go again when I'm back in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious lobster grilled cheese

0icgnmt7MYHjH1VljHqa-Q.text: I've been eyeballing this for a while and finally came to Vegas and was able to try the crab grilled cheese dipped in melted lemon bitter....OMG!!!! It was so good. I can't wait to go back to get another. It has the perfect amount of crab and cheese.... delicious!!! If I could change anything about Lukes it would be the hours. Since it's Vegas they should stay open maybe for another hour later on the weekend.

iFLIHasbbLuOJr9ACGoszw.text: As someone who frequented Luke's Lobster locations in NYC while I lived there, I was mildly disappointed in their Las Vegas location.  I just got back from lunch and am thinking to myself, "was this really Luke's?" - Something has been lost in the trip from the east coast to LV, I think.  I went with my usual, the Taste of Maine (because I'm greedy) and, while the service was great, and the seafood seemed fresh, it just... Wasn't as good as back east... I felt the rolls may have benefited from slightly more seasoning, and the rolls did not seem to have the same resistance to soggyness.  Maybe a touch too much mayo?   I couldn't really put my finger on it, but, I was mildly underwhelmed in comparison.  That's not to say I didn't enjoy my meal - On the contrary, I quite enjoyed it. Since moving from the east coast, Luke's Lobster is one of the fast casual chains that I missed. And it was still enjoyable. Even with the price hike (again, not sure if that's because it had to be transported to Vegas, or, prices have just raised since the last time I was in NYC, or, if it's just a "we're in Vegas now, so, Vegas prices" inflation.)

TOY6s1T_4ZSCCiwfTfTqRA.text: The rolls are small so don't go when you are starving unless you have at least 1.5 rolls.  It's the perfect light dinner for me :)  But boy, I am always sad when I'm on my last bite.  The first time my husband had lobster was here and I am so glad that I got to introduce lobster to him via Luke's.  Now he's a lobster addict and demands for Luke's every time we go to vegas.  Some people get weirded out by the warm bread and cold lobster.  It never bugged me at all though.  This is my perfect lobster roll.  I really don't like the slaw here.  But that's not why I go to Luke's!

2cjrCe6d1zA456M63JBT7g.text: Walking the strip I ran into this treasure!!  I had no idea what I was walking into but Zach walked me through the whole menu and helped me make my decision !!! Such hostility seriously can't find people like that in Vegas!! I will be back !! Thank you so much !!! :)

R0XjykESSgN1IZ7wxgYS5Q.text: We were in Vegas a few months ago and had Luke's Lobster for the 1st time. It was a little hard to find just because it's in an enclosure in front of the mall in the middle of the sidewalk so depending on what direction u were walking to it determined if u could find it.  The food was really good so I am still giving it 4 stars, but reluctantly because of the conditions of the seating area. There was a couple eating in there when we got there but all the other tables were vacant and filthy!!! Maybe there were coming out of a rush but in my opinion they didn't look busy enough for that to be an acceptable excuse.

zUJDNoLzSnR1qBOIsS4QXA.text: The first time I tried Luke's Lobster was in New York and I absolutely loved it! Once I found Luke's on yelp in Vegas I knew I had to go! I was in Vegas for a total of 3 days and I came to Luke's Lobster 2 out of the 3 days.. LOL. The lobster and crab rolls are just soooo good. They are very generous with their meat portions and the meat taste so fresh. This particular location is extremely small, but the quality of the food is still just as good. It is located right in front of the mall entrance. If you're not walking on the strip, I would suggest parking in Macy's lot and walk through the mall to get here! Ugh its so delicious you won't regret it!

EkiSoUL9o3gp2kj279puvQ.text: The Lobster Roll I Got was absolutely Delicious a tad small though, a dollar bill is bigger. The pictures I saw make it look a lot bigger. And the lobster is Cold Not Hot, but still tastes great if you want that lobster taste. It's a bit Pricey, but as you already know lobster is never cheap.

jYHYQ86CtxVcBQRuMsw5QA.text: This is tough, the lobster was fresh and flavorful, but this cost $18.36 each and I get something as small ball park hot dog... finished it in two and half bits. Quality is there, food had flavor but portion to price is just beyond lack luster. I even told the guys ..." That's it? That's just said" felt ripped off. Normally anytime I get a lobster roll its in a eight inch role, not a 5 inch role, and this was not stuffed by any means... Wont be back only because I can spend $20 else where and get bang for my buck. But you guys do have a good product, just need to offer more for what you get. I don't want to pay $20 for a Snickers bar worth of food.

Bu-WTBGjzcKDSI2VjaB80g.text: Amazing food. I got the trio: half a lobster roll, half a shrimp roll and half a crab roll with a cup of bisque and my husband got the trio with the clam chowder, so we could try both soups. It was honestly the best meal we had the whole time we were in Vegas!

i-z0cs0DvhocgzHKGj1AUA.text: Definitely a little hard to find, but also definitely a diamond in the rough! Service was amazing and they even told us about the other store locations! They're raising money for the Susan g komen foundation which I always think is amazing! Last, but not least, the food is absolutely amazing! We had the lobster po boy thingy and crab and cheese grilled cheese thing... they were to die for! Even though we live in anthem this was totally worth the drive!

AO9V3fX9j72G1Spfgt9W8Q.text: The lobster roll was fresh, juicy, seasoned well and so tasty! The buns were toasted but soft and buttery it melted in your mouth.We also added a side of lobster bisque  - good! But after a few bites, it became too salty.  The rolls are small and a bit expensive, but you are eating lobster in the middle of the desert...  Service was great, nice and friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll Delicious!!

-ZrN2Q_dimNlvqt5udJ8bQ.text: I dont know why I have never had Luke's Lonster rolls before. I guess I was thinking 'it cant be that good' but it was AMAZING!  My boyfriend was pretty shocked when I told him I've never had Luke's and he was like lets go in and try. We were walking out of Fashion Show after shopping and trying to walk back to Palazzo.  He said his favorite is Crab but his friends from NY likes Lobster the most, so he ordered a Luke's Trio to try all three different flavors; Lobster, Crab and Shrimp. We took a seat outside and it was all full except one table. Ot was around 3:30 PM and I was surprised to see this small place full.  Our Luke's Trio came out not too long after. Its rather a sampler size so quarter pound of each flavors. Their bread though! It was so buttery and crispy, I think the bread is what makes these rolls so yummy and delicious!! I took a bite of Crab and oh my..it was so soft, flavorful and moist! With the crisp bread, it was a perfect combination. Lobster was also so juicy, chewy and oh so fresh! I enjoyed Lobster just as much as Crab. Shrimp was also good but I will definitely choose Crab or Lobster. I know some people may think its pricey but I think its worth it to every penny!  Service provided by the staff was phenomenal. She was so friendly, polite and sweet. I really loved everything about this place. Convenient location, delicious food and amazing staff! TRY IT when you need a snack or when you are near Fashion Show after shopping for hours!

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Luke&#39;s Trio

3OjXpC-3x3gekeFRTI0lyw.text: Food was really good and tasted fresh. I had the trio with a side of clam chowder. It was really good. The only downfall was the potatoes didn't taste cooked all the way in the chowder. You can tell it was made fresh. The girls behind the counter were awesome, upbeat and full of energy when I came in. I would have never know Luke's was here unless I looked it up or was on the strip. Thankful for yelp giving me this place. Although there was a lot of food I am still hungry but it was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Luke&#39;s trio with clam chowder

uZXdGu3momC3uTpPIEPBXw.text: Was really excited about this spot. But damn the rolls are really expensive for what you're getting. I get that it's seafood but damn. I thought the seafood lacked a bit of flavor. Felt so plain. This is different from the other places I've tried. The workers are really awesome tho

7SUrcBcId-HB75EgS8wrPg.text: This place does not disappoint! I came here twice and already I want to go back! On my first time, I ordered the lobster roll combo with soup and a drink. The soup I chose was lobster corn chowder. The lobster roll was absolutely fresh and flavorful. The seasoning and sauce were light and it does not overpower the taste of the lobster. The bread was soft and buttery. The corn chowder was good and there were bits of lobster in it. However, I can barely taste the lobster in the soup. It was still good, but I think the clam chowder would be a better choice for me.  The only issue that I have was the size of the roll. It was smaller than I expected and it does not fill me up, especially for the price they are offering. Overall, I would go back and try their other rolls such as their crabs or shrimps one.

Ip7ZzMkGo2s9xipvOGVdDA.text: I found Luke's Lobster through a fellow Yelper and am so glad I did!  It's hard when you live or are visiting in the middle of the desert to find some great seafood, however Luke's offerings of lobster crab and shrimp rolls are full of ingredients and delicious!  Unfortunately though, when I say that they are full, that doesn't mean that they are filling.  My partner and I found LL pretty easily - a cute little outside 'hut' at Fashion Show with it's own private seating at the back of it. We each ordered a roll and a large clam chowder to share. We really wanted to try their lobster mac n cheese, although despite their website saying it was available from November, this was not the case.  We thoroughly enjoyed our rolls - the crab was good, but the lobster was what it was all about, juicy, seasoned well and so tasty! The toasted rolls were also very good. The only bad thing was that these rolls are quite small, but are priced so that we expected something a little more substantial. Because of this, we weren't nearly full afterwards, so we ordered the lobster grilled cheese, which wasn't as filled with lobster as the rolls, but was good nonetheless.  By the end of our meals, we weren't hungry anymore and the food was delicious. However, because of the smaller sized items and having to purchase more, a bill for two people, no drinks was over $50.   Also, as a non-smoker who tries to avoid the smell at all costs, it was a little frustrating that the outside (and pretty much only) seating backed straight on to a public smoking area. Because of this, we couldn't take our time as much as we wanted and rushed through our meal a little faster to avoid more smoke smell wafting into where we were eating.  In all, the food is great and service is good. We would definitely return for the rolls. But at the price you pay for the size you get, this would for sure be a treat for us!

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll 5/5, crab roll 4/5 and large clam chowder 3.5/5
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster roll 5/5 and large clam chowder 3.5/5

3rTaGERIBNBWhc3Sn_GgnA.text: I love Luke's Lobster in Boston and was excited to see one here and it is more like a pop-up food truck than anything else.  Of course I ordered a lobster roll and it was very good, BUT not as good as they make them in Boston. Ok, perhaps it is the ambiance of Las Vegas, but I truly believe they tasted better in Boston.  No matter, if you are in Vegas and in the mood for a lobster roll, this is a great place to satisfy that hunger.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qldeNV8Igy1RxlGqLxOW-A.text: We stayed at Encore and stumbled upon this cute tiny place in front of fashion show mall. It's lobster so of course you are going to pay. I had the trio with the lobster, shrimp, and crab. Topped with butter on soft rolls, it left me wanting more. My husband and I shared the trio but it was pretty much just a snack, we had dinner later. I will return when I visit Vegas again.

qWwTorhZ-cYK4DWKxKdtLw.text: Always enjoy my stop here.  The lobster is always seasoned perfectly.  Comes out on a toasted bun that's chewy and buttery.  Lobster is moist considering it's probably flown in from the east coast.  Tried the original and one with truffle oil.  Truffle oil was light but I enjoyed the original the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One original, one with truffle oil drizzled. Both delicious!

_ZGEZg3jj2JwPaM4CHvVdA.text: Luke's is conveniently settled outside the Fashion Show Mall facing the Venetian hotel. As soon as you walk in, the counter is a few steps away. We got there a little too late, 4:45 pm, and they ran out of all soups. My husband and I ended up ordering the trio and figured we would share it as it is expensive. For an order of trio combo that came with a drink and chips, I went ahead and ordered chips and water for myself. My total came out to $32.   As we waited, we quickly grabbed a table on their small covered patio which consists of 5 tables that seats two each.   Not to long after, our meal was delivered. Each sandwich was really good and filled. Unfortunately, the size of each sandwich is about half the size of a hot dog bun. So this was but only a snack for us.   The restaurant and dining area is clean, customer service was good as well as the sandwiches. Price is pretty high but it was a good experience overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Luke's Lobster Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Trio is half a sandwich. Good but little. I want more!

fvVRjAv27BXinNH0LF0Etg.text: Situation on the strip, in the Fashion Show Mall promenade you'll find Luke's Lobster. It's a small shack with counter service and a few tables outside for seating.   I came here two days in a row on a recent business trip solely for their $5 lobster tails. They are mini and served everyday. I would say each tail is about 3 bites but it's high quality,  delicious lobster meat that hits the spot. Would highly recommend for this alone.

Mu3CymloFQJ-MIwYmmAd8A.text: My boyfriend and I split the lobster roll and a large lobster corn chowder soup (because I wasn't that hungry). The lobster roll was so tiny for the price! And was just okay tasting too. The roll was cold and didn't seem to have much seasoning to it. The soup was a decent size, but nothing special either. I think I enjoyed the oyster crackers more than anything.   I probably would have went with the trio, but they were out of shrimp. We were there 2 hours after Luke's opened on a Sunday. Wasn't too thrilled with the food, but the two ladies working were cool.

-zBaekNpn3-U7_MDGGYnIg.text: Luke's lobster is a tiny standalone shop in front of the Fashion Show mall across from the Wynn. Order at the counter and they have a shaded patio with about 4-5 tables in the back where they bring your food to you.   LUKES TRIO $19 - 3 x 1/2 rolls of lobster, shrimp, and crab. Lobster was obviosly the best tasting being clean and sweet. Simply done with the lightly toasted buttered bread and very light mayo. Delicious. (8/10)  LOBSTER TAIl $5 - Not bad for the price. Chilled and served with warmed lemon butter it's a good snack. (8/10)  Washed it down with a Maine blueberry wildflower honey lemonade $3. Have to shake it up since the honey settles but it wasn't only sweet. Tasted like summer.    Great spot for a quick lunch on the strip.

FZ7RVhkXkzrbPLoF2NkdCQ.text: We came here for a late lunch and ordered the Luke's trio which comes with 1/2 lobster roll, 1/2 crab roll, 1/2 shrimp roll. We also got the Blueberry soda. jGtsGw3l-69JFajZrcAouQ.text: This place had a great reviews so I had high expectation. Place is overrated big time. Good taste is ok. Nothing special about the taste. Portion is too small for the price. Really sad and small sitting area outside. It was too dusty. I will not go back here nor recommend this place to others.

nlRU1u1DODabTfB1vsDKIQ.text: The employees were very friendly and helpful. I tried the Trio of lobster , shrimp and crab rolls. Overall it was good, but the quantity of food for the cost wasn't great. The lobster roll was by far the best of the 3.

KGlRGv_0echwbVHHCtG5-Q.text: Oooooooooohhhhhhhhhh! Who traveled to Sin City in search of a roll? SpongeLuke Lobster pants..And as you can see THAT's why I haven't quit my day job to nab that opening act gig on the strip..Haha  What isn't a joke however is Luke's Lobster nestled outside of the Fashion Show Mall. I really had my heart set on finding a decent lobster roll in Vegas to satisfy my Slapfish craving while away from Cali and boy did I find that here!  They have the staples: crab, lobster, and shrimp rolls and a few other seasonal items so certainly it swabs anyone's seafood poop deck. I continuously keep being hooked on the Luke's trio. It's basically three half rolls of crab, lobster, and shrimp for a modest $20 price tag however from the consistency it feels like it should be $200 (don't ever do that please) haha. What stands out is the quality and freshness. The shrimp has been one of the most tender I have tried to date and the lobster/crab are not reeking of water or salty displeasure so Luke definitely uses the force to hone his craft! I would say their secret seasoning blend is the coup de gras though as it just seems to always elevate the rolls to new heights!  A dark horse in all this ironically enough was the beverages. Ever since I first gave it a sample I have been head over heels for the blueberry lemonade. It comes in a bottleneck so it looks like I was getting hammered without the after effect, but wow between the blueberry and honey mix did that TKO my tastebuds! That certainly is a highly recommended item to snag.  So as the lighthouse dims the searchlights on the strip follow the buoys to Luke's as you will not regret it! The overall experience will leave you scaling the seven seas for your sea legs.

It's always made to order and the lobster meat in the rolls are always amazingly filled with flavor and juiciness. It's definitely a place that I find myself recommending to everything. I couldn't recommend this place more

DsznvNjoEgk3EpANCVpYsQ.text: Superb lobster just not enough to get full off of. Don't go if you're starving. A great light snack, definitely gives you you the dose of lobster you want.
